loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le village et ceux des alentours. Leur principale activité est le commerce. Ces membres vivent dans la bonne entente et la convivialité et son solidaire entre eux.
Anna, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Elle achète 07 caisses de boissons à 4500 F la caisse et le revend à 5000 F. Elle achète aussi 04 sacs de riz de 50 kg à 13 500 F le sac.
Avec les bénéfices, elle subvient à ses propres besoins, aux besoins de sa maman qui est veuve et aussi elle renforce son épargne au niveau du Banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 21 members is part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on December 21, 2009, and which brings together women who live in and around the village. Their main work involves commerce. The women live in harmony, friendship, and solidarity among themselves.

Anna, who is standing at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her main work is in commerce. She has been working at it for quite a while and has very good experience in this domain. She is purchasing 7 cases of beverages at 4,500 francs per case to resell at 5,000 francs. She is also purchasing four 50-kg sacks of rice at 13,500 francs each.

With the profits, she supports herself and her widowed mother, and she is also bolstering her savings at the 'banc villageois'.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and rice to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Janet from Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children.  


Ten years ago, Janet established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to create her daily living for her children.  She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., seven days per week. She is very hardworking and has a desire to improve her standard of living.


Janet requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of rice, flour and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. 


In the future, Janet plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of rice, flour and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Yulita

texts.en:
Yulita is a fifty-one-year-old married woman living in Kagadi, Uganda. 


She is a charcoal seller and has been in this business for twenty years. She was encouraged to start up her own business to avoid over-dependency on her husband, and this has helped to improve on the general family wellbeing. 


Her challenge is the high cost of the trading license. She hopes to build a residential house for her family.


Yulita is requesting the loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora vive en la zona de Puntarenas, Pacífico Central de Costa Rica, con su compañero y su hijo.  Tienen 5 años de trabajar en el comercio, mantiene actividades consolidadas (ventas de catálogo, ropa y bisutería) lo que permite una generación de ingresos estable y solvencia para el pago de la cuota. Inicia su trabajo  con Fundación Mujer en forma individual,  con el objetivo de mejorar las condiciones de su microempresa,  en una época muy buena para las ventas, que es la temporada navideña y de vacaciones de verano en la zona costera. Desea de apoyar en los ingresos del hogar,  invirtiendo este monto pequeño, con el objetivo de pagar rápido y volver a solicitar  un nuevo préstamo con una mayor solvencia.

Vive en una zona de mucha pobreza y con limitadas oportunidades de empleo, este préstamo  le va a  permitir adquirir mercadería,  incrementando su inventario, cubriendo así los pedidos para época de vacaciones. 

Ella realiza la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal lo que le permite tener un margen más amplio para la recuperación del dinero para el pago. Demuestran tener excelentes referencias de crédito y una amplia experiencia en el comercio.
texts.en:
Maritza
2013-253
150.000


Maritza, 36 is a hard-working woman. She lives in the area of Puntarenas, in the Central Pacific area of Costa Rica with her partner and their child. They have worked in sales for 5 years and have a consolidated activity (catalog sales, clothing and custom jewelry) which generates a stable income and solvency to pay her fees. She has started her work with the lending partner, Fundacion Mujer, on her own, with the aim to improve the conditions of her micro-business at a very good time for sales: Christmas and the summer holiday season in the coastal area.
Maritza wishes to contribute to the household income investing this small sum of money inorder to pay back quickly and then ask for a new loan with an improved solvency rate.
Maritza lives in a poor region, with limited employment opportunities. This loan will allow her to acquire merchandise, increasing her inventory to cover the demand during the holiday period. She will recover the money for the payment fees weekly, which will allow her to have a wider margin to get the money to make the payments. Maritza proves to have excellent credit references and a wide experience in commerce.

loans.use: with catalog sales, clothing and custom jewelry.

loans.name: Jaime Ignacio

texts.es: Jaime Ignacio agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente muy contento por el apoyo brindado, él continua vendiendo ceviche en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco, él continua participando en el banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limón, pescado, sal, maíz, arroz, cebolla entre otras cosas más.
texts.en: Jaime Ignacio is grateful for the previous loan and is very happy with the support received. He continues to sell ceviche in one of the most popular markets in the city of Cusco. He is still a member of the Communal Bank "Asociacion Arariwa" and he is doing very well. On this occasion, Jaime needs the loan to purchase supplies such as lemon, fish, salt, corn, rice, onions, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as lemons, fish, salt, corn, rice, onions, etc.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas e la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, donde ofrece diversos tipos de abarrotes arroz, azúcar, menestras, leche entre otros, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles, para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is forty-three years old.  She lives with her husband and their two children in the district of Oyotun, a rural area located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in this community make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

She has a small shop in her home where she offers different types of grocery products, like rice, sugar, beans, milk, and other items.  She also raises small animals in the area behind her house.  

Agustina has requested a loan of 2,000 soles to stock her business.  In doing this, she will earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products to stock her business.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería siendo su principal fuente económica, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros tiene una experiencia de 10 años en este rubro, por lo que la mayoría de su comunidad la conocen, su esposo le apoya en esta labor, el viaja a traer ropa desde la capital.

Marilu ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de ropa de temporada primavera- verano y calzado y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos, generando al mismo tiempo mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marilu is forty-four years old.  She lives together with her husband and their two children in the district of Oyotun, a rural area located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people who live here make a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

She makes a living selling clothing for children, women, and men.  She has 10 years of experience, and so the majority of those living in her community know about Marilu and her business.  Her husband helps her in this work, and he travels to the capital city in order to bring clothing back to their community.

Marilu has requested a loan of 3,000 soles to buy summer and spring clothing and footwear.  In doing this, she will offer her customers a greater variety of products while also earning a higher income to benefit her family.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la zona urbana de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio siendo sus principales fuentes económicas, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace tres años, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su negocio puede contribuir económicamente con los gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de belleza y así incrementar su negocio, ella nos explica que en estos meses aumenta su clientela y una segunda parte para arreglos navideños luces, adornos, Pesebres de arcilla entre otros y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 37, lives with her parents in the urban area of Zana, where the main economic sources for the population are farming and commerce. Zana is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, in the northern coast of Peru.
Elizabeth has been selling beauty products for three years. Her business is located in her home. She is an enterprising woman that contributes to paying for the family expenses thanks to her business.
She has asked the lending partner, "Edpyme Alternativa", a loan for 2,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase beauty products in order to increase her sales. She explains that the number of customers increases in these months. She also wants to buy Christmas ornaments such as lights and decorations such as clay nativities among others and in this way increase her income.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and Christmas ornaments.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 54 years old and widowed, with eleven children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 49 years old and married, with four children. With two children still in school, Leonila works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like laundry soap, shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, coffee, and other groceries to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as laundry soap, shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like laundry soap, shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, coffee, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from farming vegetables and raising livestock. 

Juanita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more items, such as slippers, vinegar, canned goods, seasonings, cooking oil, etc., to sell for her general store.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of  building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as slippers, vinegar, canned goods, seasonings, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her store

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a twenty-nine year old business woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She only has one child who is four months old. She has a retail shop where she earns a living and has been in the business since 2009. 
Her dream is to become a big entrepreneur in this area though her challenge is being the only income earner. Annet has to cater to all the family's needs, yet she does not have a stable income.
Annet will use the loan to buy soap, drinking water, bread and juice to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, drinking water, bread, juice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis has been providing a delivery service for over two years in Ayntap village of the Ararat region. He lives with his parents and sister in the same village. 


As a hardworking young man, he does his best to gain more customers and increase orders. Sargis has an agreement with local small stores that give their orders to Sagis, who buys needed products from Yerevan and delivers them to the stores. Realizing that the business is profitable enough for him, and that he manages to cover the family's basic costs, Sargis wants to increase his business. For being able to do that, first of all Sargis needs to renovate the car by which he organizes delivery.


Sargis has applied for this loan to be able to renovate the car. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 


The loan will help Sargis to accomplish his goals, and he hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car for his delivery service.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Mary Joy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store. 

Mary Joy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mary Joy has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 37 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilou is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming rice for 6 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase red oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inaugurer l’installation du banc villageois est la réalisation d’un vœu d’accéder au crédit pour l’ensemble des membres du groupement. Afin de mener des activités génératrices de revenu axées sur le petit commerce.

Madame Adama (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 22 ans, mariée  et mère de 02 enfants uniquement des filles. Elle tient une petite gargote au devant de sa maison où elle sert le petit déjeuner. Elle compte acquérir les différents produits au marché hebdomadaire de la zone.


Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter : 20 Kg de niébé, 02 pots de tomate concentrée, 02 sachets de lait en poudre, de même que 02 pots de lait concentré sucré, de l’ognon et divers ingrédients.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
The newly inaugurated installation of the “banc villageois” is the fulfillment of a wish of all the group members to access credit. In order to carry out income-generating activities focused on small business.

Madam Adama (seated far right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 22 years old, married and the mother of two children both girls. She runs a small eatery in front of her house where she serves breakfast. She intends to purchase her various ingredients at the weekly market in the area.

Her new loan will allow her to buy: 20 Kg black-eyed peas, 2 jars of tomato paste, 2 bags of powdered milk, as well as 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk, onions and other ingredients.

With the profits, she is planning on strengthening her savings and support her husband with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy: 20 Kg black-eyed peas, 2 jars of tomato paste, 2 bags of powdered milk, as well as 2 cans of sweetened condensed milk, onions and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ma. Celita

texts.en:
Maria Celita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. From her loan, she was able to buy more chicken and pork meat for her business.  It  also helped in the education of her child. 

Her income from business is supporting her family's every-day household expenditures. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their everyday needs. They also sell lumber for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan for her to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Celita hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams of having a new house for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week, and it is a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken and pork meat that she needs in her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita owns half a hectare of rice farm land within her local community. She is married and has been blessed with six grown children. 

She and her husband want to sustain her rice field with necessary farm inputs, but due to insufficient funds, she decided to borrow additional capital of PHP 15,000. She will be using this loan in buying farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides used in her farming business. 

She believes that through sustaining her rice field with proper care and farm inputs, she will make her rice crops more productive.She hopes that she can obtain this amount of loan in order for her to have a better way of life and save for her emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides for her farming business

loans.name: Channy

texts.en:
Channy is 40 years old and a loving mother of five children, living with her family in Bakan district of Pursat province. 

Channy is an industrious farmer who grows and harvests rice to sell in the local markets of the province. Her earnings from this business allow her to pay for her daily meals and school allowances of her children and cover other costs of commodities. Channy has been doing this type of business for more than 20 years.

Currently, Channy’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to build one to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this regard, she would like to acquire a loan of KHR 5,000,000 to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate.  It has encouraged her to focus on a healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Julieta Sofia

texts.es:
Julieta Sofía tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio siendo sus principales fuentes económicas, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene su negocio ubicado en su domicilio donde se dedica a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas y comida preparada desde hace diez años, su esposo le apoya en esta labor.

Son una familia emprendedora, Julieta ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza, gaseosas e insumos para preparar sus comidas y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Julieta Sofía is fifty-seven years old.  She lives with her husband and son in the rural area of Oyotún, located about two hours form the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in this community make a living in agriculture and trade. 

She has been running a business out of her home selling beer, carbonated beverages, and prepared food items for ten years.  Her husband helps her with this work; they are a very enterprising family.

Julieta has requested a loan of 2,500 soles to buy beer, carbonated beverages, and ingredients to make her foods.  In this way, she will grow her business and generate a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, carbonated beverages, and ingredients to prepare her food items.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline helps her husband in managing their own transportation services business to earn a living. Aside from their motorcycle, Adeline has her buy and sell business, and she earns an extra income from it. 

Recently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance. 

She is hopeful of saving more from their profit to pursue their plan of buying another unit of motorcycle in the future for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 8000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 3 years. Virginia earns additional income from food vending.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is 31 years old and married, with one child.

Annabella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her store.

Annabella has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns income from buying and selling firewood.

Annabella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Priscilla's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of six women from the same district who are active in different businesses. 

Priscilla is 36 and is the woman who is second from the right in the photograph. She is the group's representative and she is a married mother of six children, including four boys and two girls. Priscilla is active in selling maize and flour. This is a business she has completely mastered and she has been in business for 10 years before joining the loan group. Her profits will go toward savings and to meet her family's needs, as well as to help out her husband with certain areas of work.

Priscilla and the other members of the group need a total loan of GHS 3,100 so that they can buy more maize, flour, beans, distilled water, and fruit juice.

loans.use: To buy maize and flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one of whom is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Margaret operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma está casada con el sr. Ignacio  hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos que aún están en la primaria, y por quienes ambos luchan incansablemente.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicada en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando educan a sus hijos y van comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo, jabones varios y otros para poder invertir en su negocio y seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Irma has been married to Ignacio several years. They have four children who are still in primary school and for whom they fight non stop. Together they opened a pantry store in their house located in a densely populated neighborhood of the area. They started the business with a small capital they saved from previous salaried jobs they held. Thanks to their work they are educating their children and they cover all the household necessities. 
Irma is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, different types of soap, etc. to invest in their business and keep getting ahead.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, varied soaps, etc.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El Sr. Hugo es comerciante, tiene un puesto de ventas de celulares, accesorios, juguetes, etc., tiene su negocio en una zona muy recurrida por la gente.
Él es muy emprendedor, comenta que le gusta mucho ayudarles a las personas más necesitadas, y que su objetivo es tener su propio  local y tener una mayor variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en accesorios para celulares, lo que le permitirá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Hugo is a shopkeeper. He has a stand selling cell phones, accessories, toys, etc. He has a business in a very known area in the community. 
He is very entrepreneurial. He mentions that he loves to help those in need. His goal is to have his own business and to have a greater variety of products to offer to his customers.
He requested this loan to invest in cell phone accessories. This will allow him to continue offering good service to his customers. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to continue growing his business.

loans.use: purchase cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Paty Rufina

texts.es:
Paty nació en el departamento de Apurímac pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco y  tiene 22 años de edad, ella es soltera y aun no tiene hijos por el momento, ella se dedica a la venta de recordatorios en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco, ella pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE III” de la Asociación Arariwa  y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como  por ejemplo peluches, tarjetas, billeteras y otras cosas más. 

Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Paty was born in the department of Apurímac, but she currently lives in the city of Cusco. She is 22 years old and single. She still does not have any children. She makes a living selling gifts at one of the most popular markets in the city of Cusco. She is a member of the "Comuzone III" communal bank with the Arariwa Association. She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as stuffed animals, cards, wallets, and other items.

She is grateful to all of the lenders for their support and she is committed to paying her installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as stuffed animals, cards, wallets, and other items.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married, and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

Elsa has requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell. 

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en el Caserío de Culpon en el distrito de Nueva Arica, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral patos, gallinas y pavos, en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the hamlet "Caserio de Culpon", in the district of Nueva Arica, located one hour and thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the northern coast of Peru. The population works in farming, commerce and cattle raising. 
Segundo raises poultry such as ducks, hens and turkeys in his own home. He is asking for a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles to purchase balanced feed in order to improve production and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to but balanced feed to fatten poultry.

loans.name: Johnan

texts.en:
Johnan is a married man working in a transport business where he uses his motorcycle to transport people from one place to another at a reasonable fee. He works seven days a week and works ten hours per day. He also owns a small retail shop, which is run by his wife. 

Johnan started his transport business in 2009 and has carried it on to date and he is proud because it has helped him earn some income to look after his family. However, the motorcycle he was using became old and it started disturbing him on the road. This is the reason why he decided to buy another motorcycle which he is using for his transport business now. However, he bought the motorcycle on hire purchase and is expected to make the last payment early next month (December), which is why he is asking for a loan of 800,000 shillings so that he can make the final payment and become the full owner of the motorcycle.

loans.use: To pay for a motorcycle

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives simply with his two children who currently attend school. For the past six years, he has been a farmer who cultivates one hectare of rice farmland. He is also raising five hogs to be sold. Jonathan is grateful because, despite his situation as widow, he still makes his best in order to provide basic necessities to sustain his family. 

Jonathan is requesting another 30,000 PHP loan to buy necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticide that he will use for his rice farming business. He hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted so he can let his two children finish their studies and have a better way of life. Jonathan also hopes to be able to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inks and tools for his copy machine, books, pens, pencils and various kinds of school and office supplies

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es:
Benicio es mecánico, tiene un Taller en su casa, donde gracias al buen servicio que hace se hizo muy buena clientela. El Sr. es muy emprendedor y dia a día busca una mejor  estabilidad para su familia.
Su objetivo es poder seguir trabajando, y el día de mañana poder tener más sucursales de su negocio, y así también poder dar ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten de ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder ampliar su casa, lo que le permitirá también utilizar la ampliación para  su taller, ya que el mismo está dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Benicio is a mechanic. He has a repair shop at his house. Thanks to the good work he does, he has very good clientele. He is very entrepreneurial and every day, he looks for better stability for his family.
His goal is to continue working  and in the future he has a goal to have more branches of  his business. With these goals, he can help other people who need help. He requested this loan to expand his house. The expansion will allow him to also extend his auto shop since it is inside his house.

loans.use: enlarge his house.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a farmer who sells her produce in the market. For the past four years, she has been able to earn enough to provide for the needs of her family. Claire has been able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Claire is requesting a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the near future, she wants to improve her garden and the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married with an only child. For 15 years, she has helped her husband in the swine fattening business to earn a living. Lea’s business earns well to provide for the family needs. 

Lea is requesting a loan from GDMPC to purchase feed to boost her pigs. She is hopeful of gaining more profit and she plans to save a portion of it for the education of her child in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Jaime Artemio

texts.es:
Jaime Artemio tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores pavos, cerdos y patos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, su esposa le apoya en esta labor distribuyendo por los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad su negocio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y una segunda parte para la compra de animales pequeños para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Artemio is 42 years old. He lives with his family in Zaña district. Its people engage in agriculture, trade and cattle raising and it is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Perú.

He raises and sells small animals, such as turkeys, pigs and ducks, at the rear of his house. His wife supports him in this work by circulating his business to surrounding hamlets.

He has requested a loan of S/.1,000 to buy nutritional feed with a part set aside to purchase small animals to fatten and then sell at a higher price thereby generating more earnings for his family.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional feed and animals to fatten.

loans.name: Jeaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jacqueline, es madre soltera de dos hijos, tiene 43 años de edad.  Originaria de la ciudad de Masaya. De oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de comida variada. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, que con tanto empeño ha logrado salir adelante. Primero empezó vendiendo ropa, luego tomo la idea de vender comida. Hoy en día cuenta con la venta de comida lo cual le ha generado buenas ganancias. Su meta próxima es mejorar las condiciones en infraestructura de su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: plátanos, repollo, harina, arroz,jabon, gaseosas entre otros, con el fin de ofrecer una variedad en sus platillos y en su pulperia. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara su negocio y obtener buenos ingresos para el sustento de su local y su hogar. Su plan futuro es extender su negocio y vender a otras ciudades.
texts.en: Jaqueline is a 43 year old single mother.  She is from the city of Masaya and has a grocery store business.  She started it several years ago and has managed to get ahead with lots of effort.  She started out selling clothing and then got the idea to sell groceries and now she earns a good income.  Her next goal is to make improvements to her home’s infrastructure.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy bananas, cabbage, flour, soap, soft drinks, and other things so she can offer a variety of items in her store.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help to her business and that it will grow and she will have good earnings for her home.  Her future plans are to expand the business and sell in other towns.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Hanidina

texts.en:
This is 61-year-old Hanidina, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a widow and she has four children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Hanidina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by individual pieces. She also sells herbal medicines and religious items for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Hanidina dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, who is 52 and married to Rolando. They have children and live in Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Nenita and her husband manage their household while operating their variety store. She is working hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nenita earns a profit by buying wholesale supplies and selling by piece. She also sells herbal medicine and religious items to earn additional income. Nenita’s regular customers are her neighbors and local community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Nenita is requesting a 15,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and help her continue her business. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Heam

texts.en:
Heam is 27 years old and married with two children. She was photographed in front of her house located in Baray district of Kampong Thom province. Since she was with her parents, Heam has been engaged in agricultural businesses. She farms rice and cassava as well as raises pigs. She is very happy because her husband is very supportive and always helps her to manage their household businesses. Through her hardships, Heam is able to generate 5 USD each day for her family’s expenses. 

Heam is requesting a 600 USD loan to buy a piece of land for farming. Without her loan, she won’t be able to increase her farming productivity. Heam expresses her thanks to all kind lenders for their generosity. In the coming season, she hopes to have a fruitful harvest that she can sell in the market at a good price.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming

loans.name: Maluay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Maluay está formado por 12 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar de hermosos paisajes, donde se puede admirar  sus verdes campos productos de sus sembríos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres, son personas luchadoras que a pesar de los obstáculos luchan para cumplir sus objetivos, todos luchan para mejorar su situación económica y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Natividad, es socia del grupo de crédito Maluay desde hace un año y medio, se encuentra en este grupo porque les ayuda a afianzarse más como vecinas, comparten un tiempo que muchas veces por su trabajo no pueden, a mas que reciben una charla de educación la misma que les ayuda en su vida cotidiana.
La Señora Natividad tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad y su segunda hija en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión sastre, no tienen casa propia por que viven arrendando.
Doña Natividad pasa en casa pero desde hace 25 años es toda una profesional en el área de la costura, trabaja con su esposo y labora de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, realizan todo tipo de arreglos y  prendas de vestir. 
El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de telas, hilos y repuestos para sus máquinas de coser. Su meta es tener un taller más grande.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Maluay communal bank is made up of 12 women who live in the outskirts of the parish of Valle in Cuenca. This area is characterized by beautiful scenery. One can admire the green fields, products of the sowing season. The architecture is a mix of colonial and modern styles. The local people maintain the culture and traditions they learned from their parents. They are hardworking people who, despite obstacles, fight to achieve their goals. They are all fighting to improve their financial situation and give their families a better future.

One of the members of this group is Natividad. She has been a member of the Maluay communal bank for one and a half years. She is in this group because it helps the members to support each other as neighbors. They share time together, which they don't get to do often due to work. They also listen to educational speeches, which helps them in their daily lives.

Natividad, 46, is married and has two children, ages 13 and 19. Her oldest daughter is at university and her younger daughter is in high school. Her husband is a tailor. They do not own a house, so they are renting.

Natividad has been a professional seamstress for 25 years. She works with her husband from Monday to Saturday without a fixed schedule. They do all kinds of alterations and make garments. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of fabric, thread, and spare parts for her sewing machines. Her goal is to have a bigger workshop. The smaller inserted picture is of a member who was not able to appear in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, and spare parts for sewing machines.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, café, arroz y cacao, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de ganado vacuno y mulos, Augusto compra ganado en caseríos aledaños y las ventas lo realiza en Chiple una zona conocida donde la mayor parte de ganaderos se reúnen a la venta de cabezas de ganado vacuno.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un mulo y una cabeza de ganado para ofrecer a su clientes y de esta manera generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Augusto is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the Pomahuaca district. The people grow fruit, coffee, rice and cacao, sell the same items and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the northern mountains of Peru.

He sells cattle and mules. Augusto buys the livestock in nearby communities and he sells his goods in Chiple, an area where a large part of the ranchers meet to sell heads of cattle.

He has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase a mule and a head of cattle to offer to his customers. With these sales, he will be able to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: purchase a mule and a head of cattle.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Señor Rubén tiene 40 años, es soltero trabaja en conjunto con su madre como comerciante, tienen una librería y fotocopiadora en su casa, comentan que tienen una importante clientela formada ya que son los únicos que se dedican a esto desde hace 8 años.
Gracias a esta actividad ellos han podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
Ruben pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la reparación de su local, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ruben is 40 years old and single. He works in sales with his mother. They have a bookstore and a photocopier in their home. They say that they have a significant established clientele since they are the only ones who have been working in this for the past 8 years. Thanks to this activity, they have been able to get ahead, maintain their home, and cover any unexpected expenses. Ruben is requesting this loan to repair his store, which will allow him to continue working and providing good service to his customers.

loans.use: to expand his retail space.

loans.name: Badarch

texts.en: Badarch, 36 years old, lives with her husband and three children in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on her father's land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse in a hospital since 2011 and at the same time, during her day off, she studies toxicology at medical college. Her husband works as an automobile driver at a private firm. She is requesting a loan of 970,000 MNT to pay for tuition fees as she has currently no cash at her side. The investment in education has a high return as it will open the opportunities for higher salary, promotion in the workplace and respect from others.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
The Taman Indah group received another loan from MUK. The group has eight members and each member gets 1.4 million IDR or 1.2 million IDR. These loans are used to support the efforts of pig fattening.

Ni Wayan will use her loan to buy superior quality piglets for fattening. She already has a local sow and the piglets are usually used for pig barbequing. The price today is Rp. 450,000 per piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Wayan has been feeding her pigs with traditional feed made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves. Ni Wayan pursues pig fattening to support the family.

loans.use: to buy  superior quality piglets for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her car to continue providing her taxi service in town

loans.name: Josue

texts.en:
Hard work and patience has been Josue's guiding principle in running his farming business. Josue is married and has four children. Two of his children have married and the other two are working.

Josue owns one hectare of a rice field. He has been running this kind of business for over 26 years. Now, he plans to purchase fertilizer and insecticides to improve the growth of his rice crop, but his capital is not enough due to the high cost of basic commodities and the high price of farm inputs by traders. 

With regards to this situation, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. He believes that having this amount of money will enable him to obtain a plentiful harvest and earn better profits someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides to use for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is the youngest among five siblings. She is 20 years old, single and still studying. Grace aims to help her parents in generating income. So at her very young age, she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 30,000 that will be used to maintain their family rice crop production. 

The amount she requested will be use to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pay for labor costs in transplanting her rice farm. She knows that through providing her parents with additional capital surely, they can obtain better yields and income throughout the harvest season. Grace hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan in order to have a greater income, finish her studies and have a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pay for labor costs in transplanting her rice farm

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales piña, plátanos, lima, naranjas y al comercio de los mismos y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca costa note del Perú.

El brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante su mototaxi, ocasionalmente hace traslado de derivados de construcción como arena, ripio a las zonas al3edañas a su comunidad.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para arreglos de su movilidad y una segunda parte para arreglar la fachada de su domicilio, permitiéndole de esta manera seguir trabajando con seguridad en su vehículo y un ambiente agradable en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old and lives with his son in the District of Pucará. His town is known for cultivating fruits such as pineapples, bananas, limes, and oranges; as well as for selling these same fruits and for livestock breeding. This community is located two hours away from the city of Jaén, which is located in the region of Cajamarca on the northern coast of Peru.

Francisco provides transportation services to passengers with the use of his motorcycle taxi. Occasionally he transports construction supplies, such as sand and gravel, to the surrounding areas of his community.

Francisco is requesting a loan of 1,200 PEN so that he can repair his vehicle. Part of the money will also be used to repair the façade of his home. The loan will enable him to continue working with a safe vehicle and to have a pleasant atmosphere in his home.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to repair the façade of his home.

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Paz has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Ma. Paz has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Munkhtur

texts.en: Munkhtur, 26 years old, lives with his wife in a house on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Their five year-old daughter is currently living with her grandparents in the countryside. He began working as technologist at leather factory in 2011. His wife has position of tailor at the same factory he works. He is requesting a loan of 7500000 MNT to buy electric car for personal use. The advantage of electric car is less emissions and less fuel. He will use his car for transportation purpose as well as taxi service as an additional income source.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años reside en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 12 años de edad. Rosa es una mujer increíble quien se preocupa por dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la plantación de árboles  frutales y florales tales como limón, naranja, coco, y camote. De esta forma se gana la vida ya que cuando sale la cosecha la pone a la venta y gracias al buen producto que recoge  muchas personas la prefieren y cada día le  demandan  más sus productos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de abono para los árboles frutales y florales los cuales sus frutos significan su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and her 12-year-old son. She is an incredible woman who is concerned about providing her family with better living conditions. For the past eight years, she has been cultivating fruit trees and flowering plants including lemons, oranges, coconuts, and sweet potatoes. Rosa earns her living by harvesting her products and offering them for sale. As a result of having good products, many people prefer to do business with her. Therefore, she experiences great demand for her products each day.

Rosa is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can invest in compost for her fruit trees and flowering plants. The output that they produce is her main source of income.

loans.use: to buy compost for her fruit trees and flowering plants.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия 54-летняя замужняя женщина. Она занимается торговлей, а именно куплей и продажей мужской одежды. Хотя Зулфия имеет высшее образование, но она не работала по специальности. Последние 10 лет она посвятила себя бизнесу. Ей нравится заниматься собственным бизнесом и получать от этого прибыль. У Зулфии любящий муж и четверо замечательных детей с которыми она проживает в районе Рудаки. Она любит свою семью и всегда старается ради их блага. 
В данный момент Зулфия нуждается в кредите. Так как наступили холода, ей необходимо привести сезонный товар для развития бизнеса. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для приобретения сезонной мужской одежды.
texts.en: Zulfiya is 54 years old and married.  She works in retail, specifically buying and selling men's clothing.  Though Zulfiya has a higher education, she has not worked in her field of study.  For the last 10 years, she has run her own business.  She likes running her own business and receiving an income from it.  Zulfiya has a loving husband and four excellent children who live with her in the Rudaki region.  She loves her family and always tries to do her best for them.  At the moment, Zulfiya is in need of a loan.  Since it has become cold, she needs to bring in seasonal goods to increase her business.  With that goal in mind, she is asking for a loan to buy seasonal men's clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal men's clothes to increase her business

loans.name: Gilia

texts.es: Gilia, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, es viuda, sus hijos ya son independientes, vive en su casa propia la cual compro con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Gilia es la venta de comidas como desayunos, menús y otros. Estableció su negocio en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad. Atiende principalmente por las mañanas, pero en ocasiones lo hace también por las noches. Sus clientes son transeúntes de la zona, vecinos y amistades, por fortuna su establecimiento tiene buena acogida gracias a la buena sazón de sus comidas. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 10 años, emprendió esta aventura con ayuda de su cuñada gracias a un crédito financiero que obtuvieron, ahora trabajan juntas atendiendo siempre de manera cordial. En esta oportunidad solicitara 1500 soles, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual. Con el monto solicitado compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, carnes, verduras, entre otros, para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en: Gilia is 59 years old. She is a resourceful and hardworking woman, she is a widow and her children are economically independent. She lives in a house of her own she has made many sacrifices to buy. Gilia sells meals such as breakfast and lunch menus. She has set her stall in a very crowded market of her town. She mainly works in the mornings, but at times she also works in the evenings. Her customers are passers-by of the area as well as neighbors and friends, and her activity is luckily well attended thanks to the rich taste of her dishes. She has been engaged in this activity for almost 10 years, having started this adventure thanks to the support of her sister-in-law and to a loan they had received. They now work together, always tending to their customers in a cordial way. In this occasion she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN and she is grateful to those who are making it possible for her to get this loan, as through this mean she will feel more certain of the progress of her activity. On the other hand, she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues in a punctual way. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and other items to prepare her meals.

loans.use: To buy rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Nolie

texts.en: Nolie is married with 2 children. Nolie is 39 years old and lives in Katipunan Sinacaban, Philippines. He sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, he earns about PHP5,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell such as fabric conditioners, toothpastes, powders, detergents, shampoos, noodles, cigarettes,etc. Nolie has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Nolie hope to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell such as fabric conditioners, toothpastes, powders, detergents, shampoos, noodles, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Maelyn

texts.en:
Maelyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. After four years in the business, Maelyn has provided for her family's needs and has been able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

She was also engaged in growing and harvesting bananas. Recently, she requested a new loan to buy fertilizer and salt for the farm. Maelyn is hopeful to gain more profit to improve the general standard of living for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and salt for the farm

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 55 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 
Nelly is engaged in dressmaking activity and earns approximately PHP5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth and accessories for her dressmaking business activity. Nelly has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional cloth and accessories for her dressmaking business

loans.name: May Annelieze

texts.en:
May Annelieze is married with 4 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Philippines.
She sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 50,000 to purchase additional goods to sell such as coffees,sugar,milk,beauty soaps,detergents,etc.
May Annelieze has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, May Annelieze hope to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell such as coffee, sugar, milk, beauty soaps, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Rayzen

texts.en:
Rayzen is an 18-year-old student in one of the universities in Ozamiz City. She lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her parents. Her father is a farmer. 

This year, she needs financial assistance since her parents were not able to provide for her school obligations. She joined GDMPC and her previous loan was used to pay her tuition. She borrowed a new loan recently to pay the school fees for the second semester. She positively hopes to finish her studies and be able to find a job in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for the second semester

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is Juliet, 52, resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Juliet operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trapping. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Juliet dreams to have more sewing machine that she can use and hopes to help her children so she wouldn’t be a burden to them. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto Carlos tiene 31 años, de edad vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Zaña, su principal fuente económica de la comunidad es la agricultura, comercio y turismo, ubicada a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, es muy conocido en la zona por la actividad d que realiza, ocasionalmente se dedica a labores agrícolas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para arreglar la habitación de sus hijos y la compra de reposteros de su cocina y de esta manera poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 31 years old. He lives together with his family in the district of Zaña. The community's main economic activities are agriculture, commerce and tourism. It is located one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. 

He provides transportation services using his own moto-taxi, carrying his customers to settlements far from his community. He is well-known in the area because of the work that he does. He occasionally also does agricultural work. 

He has requested a loan of 1,000 Peruvian new soles to renovate his children's room and to buy cabinets for his kitchen. In this way he will be able to complete the construction of his home.

loans.use: to complete his children's room and buy cabinets for his kitchen.

loans.name: Fenda's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois, il regroupe des femmes du même village de plus elles partagent des liens de parentés ce qui facilite la cohésion et la solidarité. Elles sont très dynamiques et  ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fenda,  (assise  à l’extrême gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle tient une table au village où elle vend des légumes, du  piment, du poivre et autres ingrédients alimentaires qu’elle achète au marché régional pour la revente au détail au village.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter quatre seaux de piment frais et s’approvisionner en légume frais.

Les revenus de l’activité lui permettent d’aider son mari en cherchant à rendre meilleur les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
The group was created during the inauguration of the “banc villageois”. It brings together women from the same village. More over, they share ties of kinship, which facilitates cohesion and solidarity. They are very dynamic and their main activity is the operation of a small business.

Mrs. Fenda (seated far left) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 53 years old, married and mother of six children. She runs a table in the village where she sells vegetables, chili, pepper and other ingredients. She buys her supplies at the regional market for retail sale in the village.

With this loan she will buy four buckets of fresh chili and stock up on fresh vegetables.

The income from this activity allows her to help her husband in improving the family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four buckets of fresh chili and stock up on fresh vegetables

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.en:
Mahmadullo was born in 1977. He is a kind person. Mahmadullo is married and has 5 children. He has been busy with a taxi business for more than 3 years. He does not have higher education. Mahmadullo always wanted to get a higher education. 

Mahmadullo services his customers with his Opel Astra. Nowadays, his business is not going well. He must repair his car. Mahmadullo is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to repair his car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Cherry Dae

texts.en:
Cherry Dae is married with 2 children. Cherry Dae is 25 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Philippines.

Cherry Dae sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to serve as additional capital for her buy and sell business.

Cherry Dae has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Cherry Dae hopes to provide for her families daily needs.

loans.use: to serve as additional capital for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Anamer

texts.en: Anamer owns and operates a motorcycle transportation service based business and a general store to earn a living. For over eleven years of running the business, Anamer earns well for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to purchase a motorcycle. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell to boost her general store. Anamer is hopeful of seeing her business successful and able to improve the general living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en: Marlon is married with four children and runs a retail store in Ozamiz City. He has been selling used shoes for eleven years and he earns a good living. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more used shoes to resell. He saves a portion of his profits for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes to resell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Agricultural and transportation businesses have been Roberto's involvement. He started his farming business when he was 16 years of age, and it was in 2009 when he started his transportation business. He operates motorcycle transport. In addition, he raises hogs to sell as his additional source of income. He is married with two children. One of them is an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) while his younger child is still attending school.

Roberto's main goal is to have a viable source of income so he can secure his family's future and let his younger child finish his studies. To make his dreams possible, he is seeking a loan of PHP10,000. He will be using this amount of loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides to keep his rice farm land productive throughout the harvest season. Roberto believes that his success relies on his own determination and initiative in running his agricultural and transportation businesses.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is aged 57 and blessed with three children. To supplement her husband's income, she engages herself in selling snacks in the street and at the bus terminal. She aims to improve the business and increase her income to satisfy the necessities of her family and to save for their future. 

To improve the business, she is in need of additional capital amounting to PHP 15,000 to buy coconut pie, coconut juice, momma and boiled corn to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy coconut pie, coconut juice, momma and boiled corn to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 67 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her general store for 25 years and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, dried fish, candies, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. Cecilia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, dried fish, candies, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 59 years old and widowed with eight children. Presentacion works very hard to provide for them.

Presentacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Presentacion has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, shampoo, sugar and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Presentacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Tilapia fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is single. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water; her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two months, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding, and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en:
Rosebell is 36 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Rosebell would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes, son una familia que se esfuerza, su esposo brinda servicios como maestro albañil.

Elsita como la conocen ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de cerdos y pavos y así poder ofrecer más variedad d a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and lives with her husband and son in the District of Nueva Arica, a rural district of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

She raises and sells farm animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs. Her family is industrious. Her husband provides his services as a master bricklayer.

Elsita, as she is known, is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN in order to buy pigs and turkeys. This will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora, 43, is married and blessed with six children. She has been selling vegetables in their village for two to three years, and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. She's also selling hogs for pig roasting for additional income. Her profits are usually spent on school allowances for her two children, and purchasing kitchen utensils to use. 

Due to financial constraints, she's asking for a loan of PHP 43,000 to purchase vegetables to sell such as cabbages, carrots, and string beans. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell such as cabbages, carrots, and string beans.

loans.name: Decenia

texts.en:
Decenia is married with two children; she runs a piggery for a living. She has been raising pigs and selling them in town to earn well for the family. She was also engaged with other businesses, like transportation services and nipa making. She always finds ways to augment their living. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase feed and do piggery maintenance. 

She is hopeful to improve her business; she earns a good income currently. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and do piggery maintenance

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana operates a fruit and vegetables selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. The previous loan helped her to buy tomatoes, vegetables, potatoes, and onions, and she gained more profit which enabled her to support her family well.

She is again requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 - she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables to sell. 

She dreams of expanding, and establishing a retail shop in the future to earn more profit and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mirtala

texts.es:
Doña Mirtala tiene una edad de 33 años ella está acompañada y es madre de 3 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa con un grado de educación de primaria completa la cual gracias al apoyo de sus padres en su juventud pudo terminar. Sus tres hijos estudian en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y en ocasiones contribuyen en las diferentes actividades de campo que ella y su compañero de hogar realizan para asistir sus cultivos de café. la Familia de su conyugue ha sido agricultora durante generaciones y la de ella no es la excepción dedicándose en compañía de su compañero de hogar al cultivo café el cual es comercializado en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Las tierras que trabajan son propias y están ubicadas a medio kilómetro de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan caminando.
Ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos entre otros para dar asistencia técnica y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales están en su punto para poder producir una buena cosecha y aprovecharla al máximo.
Los planes son los de poder incrementar el área de cultivo implementar equipo (maquinaria) que puedan ayudar a incrementar los ingresos y disminuir los costos como una despulpadora. Como madre para sus hijos apoyarlos en sus estudios y dar la oportunidad que ella no tuvo en su juventud por la falta de apoyo económico ya que con esta solicitud buscan mejorar sus ingresos, que las ganancias sean más ya que sus metas son asegurar la plantación y aprovecharla al máximo este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mirtala is 33 years old, married, and has three children.  She is a farmer and housewife with an elementary school education, which she was able to complete thanks to her parents’ support.   Her children attend elementary school in different grades and they sometimes help her and her husband with the field tasks raising coffee.
