Her husband’s family has been farmering for generations and hers is no exception.  She and her husband raise coffee which they sell in the local market and to some suppliers who visit the area.  They own their farmlands, located a half a km from their home, and they walk there.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy fertilizer, compost, and other things to help maintain her coffee crops and allow them to produce to their fullest extent, so she will have a good harvest.

Her future plans are to be able to increase her crop area and use farm machines that can help increase her income and reduce her costs.  As a mother, she wants to support her children with their educations and provide them the opportunity that she didn’t have due to lack of financial support.  This loan will help her increase her income and meet her goals of securing her plantation and taking maximum advantage of this financing.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, trabaja como secretaria desde hace más de un año. Esta siguiendo el 1er año de  la carrera de Administración de Empresas, ella destaca que saca fuerzas de donde sea para luchar día a día contra las adversidades, pues las cosas no son fáciles ya que al mismo tiempo de estar trabajando, y estudiando es también madre y es por su hijo todo es esfuerzo que está realizando. Sueña con obtener su título universitario, y llegar a ser una Licencia reconocida por su buena labor.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y así ni tener que preocuparse por esa cuenta, y estudiar tranquila.
texts.en:
Mirian is from the city of Curuguaty. She has been working as a secretary for more than a year. Mirian is in her first year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. She emphasizes that she draws strength from wherever she can, which helps her to deal with daily adversities. Things are not easy since she is working and studying at the same time. In addition, Mirian is a mother and does everything she can for the sake of her child.

She dreams of obtaining her university degree and becoming a professional who is recognized for her good work. Mirian is requesting this loan in order to invest in her installment payments so that she can stop worrying about bills and be able to study in peace.

loans.use: to pay for her university expenses.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is a 21-year-old single man living in Taiz, Yemen. He is a bus driver and works hard to earn his daily income. However, he is still a student. He faces difficult situations that are forcing him to be a responsible young man and provide for his family. He said that his daily income is not enough to cover household expenses and home improvements. So, he is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new fridge to be able to keep food and soft drinks. Taking this loan will offer him a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase a new fridge in order to keep food and soft drink.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Nancy, es una madre soltera que disfruta ver crecer a su hija de 3 años de edad, no posee ayuda del extranjero, es ella la responsable de proporcionar a su hija alimentación, salud y vestuario. Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos por iniciativa propia emprendió en negocio que consiste en vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también ofrece a sus clientes cosméticos. Hasta la fecha no ha tenido ningún problema en administrarlo.
Surtirá su inventario comprando lociones, cremas corporales, blusas, pantalones y trajes para niños, lo que le permitirá tener variedad de producto para la época navideña. Espera aumentar sus ventas, ampliar el negocio, tener mejores ingresos y seguir cubriendo los gastos de su familia.
Anhela ampliar su negocio, adquirir un local más grande y mejorar su economía para darle a su hija un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Nancy is a single mother who enjoys watching her three-year-old daughter grow. She does not receive any assistance from abroad. Nancy is responsible for feeding, clothing, and providing health care for her daughter. Since she needed to generate income, Nancy took the initiative to start a business that involves selling clothes for women, men, and children. She also offers cosmetics to her customers. As of this date, Nancy has not had any problems with managing her business.

She will restock her inventory by purchasing lotions, body crèmes, blouses, trousers, and children's outfits. This will enable her to have a variety of products for the Christmas season. Nancy hopes to increase her sales, expand her business, generate more income, and continue providing for her family's expenses. She hopes to expand her business by acquiring a larger shop, which will result in a better financial situation in which she can offer her daughter a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy lotions, body crèmes, blouses, trousers, and children's outfits to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 71 years old, a widow and has 9 adult children. All of her children are married. She lives in Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. 

Consolacion has engaged in a coco farming business for 50 years and this is her primary source of income earning her a monthly income of PHP 5,000. Consolacion has requested a new loan to buy 5 pigs to feed as another source of income. She remains a member in good standing in Paglaum and wish to save more out of her new business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 pigs to feed

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou, une dame de la cinquantaine, s’active dans la transformation de fruits. Elle fabrique des jus de fruits concentrés et a démarré le métier depuis plus de dix ans. Elle a appris les techniques de base lors d’une formation dispensée à des femmes du village où elle habite. Ayant démarré avec ses propres moyens et une petite quantité et voyant que cela rapportait, elle a envie d’augmenter la production. Elle fait donc recours à l’IMCEC pour acheter la matière première : du sucre, du gingembre, de l’oseille, du tamarin, du citron, et les ingrédients qui vont avec, pour donner du gout aux jus.
Fatou est mariée et mère de famille, et avec ce qu’elle gagne, elle peut donner sa participation à la gestion de la maison.
Si elle a les moyens, elle aimerait avoir une grande unité de production, employer des jeunes et devenir une grande fournisseur.
texts.en:
Fatou is a lady around fifty years old; she is in the fruit processing business. She produces fruit juice concentrates and started the business over ten years ago. She learned the basic techniques in a workshop provided to women of the village where she lives. She started with her own financial resources and with small amounts [of production] and saw what it could bring in, she now would like to increase her production.

She is therefore reaching out to IMCEC to buy the raw material: sugar, ginger, sorrel, tamarind, lemon, and all the ingredients needed to give juices a good taste.

Fatou is married and a mother, with her income she is able to participate to the management of the household expenses.
If she has the means, she would like to have a large production unit,  and employ young people and become a major supplier.

loans.use: to produce fruit juice concentrates for resale.

loans.name: Paula Cristina

texts.es:
Paula de 27 años de edad, originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicamentos genéricos y naturales como losartan, atenolol, acetaminofen, novalgina, talerdin, glibenclamida, triple antibiótico. Ella dedica a  su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Paula agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Paula is 27 years old and comes from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with a desire to improve her position in life. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Unfortunately she was not able to study for a career, and she found herself needing to work starting at a young age. 

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she works selling generic and natural medicines, such as losartan, atenolol, acetaminofen, novalgina, talerdin, glibenclamida, and triple antibiotic cream. She dedicates herself to her business about 12 hours per day, offering her products. The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, so that in the near future she will be able to obtain a better income. Paula is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors are providing to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they will have opportunities to work with dignity.

loans.use: to stock her business with a variety of medicines to sell.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 41 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a house on a fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting passengers from one district to another since 2006. His wife is a cook and works in a cafeteria. Their daughters are both first year students at the medical and technical colleges respectively. 

The micro-bus he uses for transportation has been deteriorating over the years, so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts. After repairing his micro-bus, he will continue to render transportation service to local people and generate income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his micro-bus.

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en:
Djabrayil is 29 years old, married, and has a child. His baby is four years of age and goes to a nursery school. Djabrayil’s wife is a teacher in a nursery school. His family lives in Baku region. 

He sells disposable glass, different bags, etc. to markets and stores. For this job, he needs a car. But his car was damaged a while ago. Now Djabrayil needs a loan in the amount of 650 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair his car and resume his work. 

He is greatly thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for the aid. In the future, he plans to open a store. Djabrayil wants to have a more lucrative business and give a good education to his child.

loans.use: to repair his damaged car to resume his work.

loans.name: Lutfidin

texts.ru: Лутфидин житель района Гиссар. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и у него двое маленьких детей. Лутфидин сейчас безработный. Он уже давно ищет работы, но не находит работы с хорошей оплатой. Он решил начать свой бизнес и предоставлять услуги такси. Однако для покупки машины ему не хватает собственных сбережений. Лутфидин единственное решение видит в получении кредита. Он просит в кредит недостающую сумму и собирается купить машину марки Daewoo Tico. Лутфидин планирует работать по маршрутной линии район Гиссар-город Душанбе. Благодаря кредиту у него будет работа и источник дохода, чтобы обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en: Lutfidin is a 27-year-old resident of the Gissar region in Tajikistan.  He is married, and has 2 small children.  Lutfidin is currently unemployed; he's been looking for a job for quite a long time, but has yet to find one that pays as well as he'd like.  He has decided to start up his own business as a taxi driver; however, he lacks the money to buy a taxi.  As such, Lutfidin feels his only option is to take out a loan, and is requesting a loan for as much money as necessary to buy a Daewoo Tico to use as a taxi.  This loan will allow Lutfidin to not only have a job, but a source of stable income for his family as well.  Once he's a taxi driver, he plans on working a fixed route in the city of Dushanbe (in Gissar).

loans.use: buy a car (Daewoo Tico) to start up a new business (taxi driving).

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Marilyn engages in buying and selling vegetables at the market. She aims to earn a higher income to provide the necessities for her family and support the education of her children. 

She plans to acquire more stocks of vegetables to resell, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more stocks of beans, cauliflower, okra, bitter melon, onions, and garlic to resell. Through this loan, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of beans, cauliflower, okra, bitter melon, onions, and garlic to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose operates a fruits and vegetables stall. The previous loan helped her to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits for resale.

Here again, she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000. She wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She appreciates the support and she thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. Her previous loan helped her expand and run her business well. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Aleko

texts.en:
Aleko is 38 years old. He lives in the Lagodekhi district with his wife, retired parents and child. 

Aleko works as a security guard and his wife is employed at the local pharmacy. They get small monthly salaries which are hardly enough for covering household expenses.

With the received credit, Aleko will start a pig farm. He will purchase small piglets and feed for them. After five or six months, Aleko will have additional piglets for sale. He will sell the piglets in the village as well as at the local open market. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and in the future, they will have enough income to access regular credit products that are available on the country’s capital market. This will enable them to further expand the family farm.

loans.use: to start a pig farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fifty more pairs of shoes

loans.name: Bernarda De Jesus

texts.es: Bernarda de Jesús mayor de edad madre soltera con cuatro hijos todos independientes originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, sus hermosas playas, turismo, se dedica a al compra y venta de mercadería en general, como: pantalones, cosméticos, ropa interior para damas, vestidos, perfumenes, blusas, entre otros, su forma de trabajar es de manera ambulante y en sus casa de habitación, al igual que también realiza de bordados y costura, sus compras las realiza al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales les ofrece los productos al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal o quincenal, al igual que también vende hielo en su casa de habitación diario, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de diversos estilos de ropa, cosméticos, también en compra de hilos agujas especiales, entre otros mas y así tener surtido su mercadería debido a la temporada navideña que es cuando mas crece su demanda y poder satisfacer a sus clientes brindadoles una mejor atención, Bernarda agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Bernarda de Jesús is an older single mother of four children who are all economically independent. She comes from a town of the Chinandega province, in the west of the country, an area where trade is the main activity, also famous with tourists for its beautiful beaches. She is a retailer, buying and selling products such as trousers, cosmetics, lady’s underwear, dresses, perfumes, and blouses. She is a street vendor but she also works in her house, producing embroideries and needlework. She buys her product for cash and she has established and occasional customers to whom she sells her products for cash and on credit that she collects on a weekly or fortnightly base. She also sells ice from her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy different kinds of clothes, cosmetics, thread and special needles; she wants to supply her stock in view of the Christmas season, being this the time of the year when she gets the highest number of requests, and she wants to meet her customers’ needs offering them a better service. Bernarda is deeply grateful for the support provided to people with meager economic resources by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothes, cosmetics, thread and special needles.

loans.name: La Fortune Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Lukenge est une Couturière depuis 3 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «  La Fortune» âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui sont tous grands. Elle est couturière et vendeuse des matériels de couture. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir  pour acheter des nouveaux matériels de couture(ciseaux, tissus, ficelle, mordoré,etc.). Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Elle avait reçu son premier  fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier de grande renommé  et  nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle
texts.en:
The customer, Lukenge has been a seamstress for three years and a member of the business group "Fortune". She is 56 years old, married with two children who are all grown. She is a seamstress and sells sewing equipment.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. This new loan will enable her to buy new sewing materials (scissors, fabric, string, mordoré, etc.) 

Her spouse is a public service employee.  She received her first loan through her husband. In the future she would like to build a large well-known workshop and feed her children. 
She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs by granting them access to credit without the need for collateral.

loans.use: to buy new sewing materials (scissors, fabric, string, mordoré, etc.)

loans.name: 6 Palomas Group

texts.es: El Grupo “6 Palomas”  está conformado por seis mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables, anteriormente eran cuatro integrantes pero a su grupo se sumaron dos personas más es por eso que decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su asociación. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua donde la celebración más grande ocurre los días 28 y 29 de septiembre: hay una gran carrera de caballos, por las calles pasean al Santo San Miguel, se escuchan cohetes muy fuertes y en la víspera se queman fuegos artificiales conocidos como toritos o castillos. Doña Rosa, o Rosy como le dicen de cariño, es una integrante del grupo platica que tiene 43 años de edad está casada desde hace 24 años con el señor Macario y juntos han formado una familia con nueve hijos, 2 hombres y siete mujeres  cinco de ellos aún son dependientes. Mientras Don Macario trabaja en el campo, Doña Rosy tiene un pequeño de negocio de mercería es por eso que está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA para comprar más mercancía como aretes, anillos, pulseras de fantasía, también vende hilos y telas cuadrille para tejer entre otras cosas, dice que aunque son cosas muy sencillas y chicas le va muy bien comenta que su negocio tiene 15 años su negocio arranca porque Doña Rosy tenía grandes deseos de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar “Yo veía como mi esposo trabajaba por mucho tiempo pero el dinero no nos rendía y no alcanzaba para solventar todos los gastos del hogar y la educación de todos nuestros niños”. El negocio lo inició en la casa de su suegra, pero sus ventas no eran muy favorables como se esperaba entonces fue como decidió cambiar el negocio a la su casa, pero en la casa de su suegra dejó un molino de nixtamal que también renta. Doña Rosy está muy contenta con su negocio y dice que quiere seguir luchando para no abandonarlo, porque por el momento su gran dificultad es la competencia en su misma comunidad, Doña Rosy comento “Mi sueño mas grande es poder mejorar el local porque ahora solo esta techado con laminas y ampliar mas para vender otros artículos". Rosy también tiene el anhelo de comprar una camioneta y salir a ranchar (ofrecer los productos en otras comunidades) y así poder aumentar sus ganancias para solventar sus gastos del hogar y de educación de sus niños. Los integrantes del grupo son Gloria quien invertirá su crédito en pollos y bordados, Teresa comprara borregos, Martina obtendrá unos guajolotes, Miriam invertirá en sus cerdos y Catalina comprará un molino de nixtamal. Todas están muy agradecidas con VisionFund y KIVA por el crédito porque de alguna manera ayudaran en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
The group “6 Palomas” ["6 Doves"] is made up of six women who are very hard-working and responsible. Previously they were four members, but two more people joined the group. For that reason they decided to choose this name for the association. They live in a community of the Mazahua people, where the largest festival happens on September 28 and 29. There is a big horse race; people go through the streets to Santo San Miguel; loud rockets are heard; and in the evening people light fireworks known as "toritos" ["little bulls"] or "castillos" ["castles"]. 

Rosa, or Rosy as her friends call her, is a member of the communal bank. She is 43 years old and has been married for 24 years to Macario; together they have formed a family with nine children, two boys and seven girls. Five of them are still dependent. While Mr. Macario works in the countryside, Ms. Rosy operates a small notions store. For this reason she is requesting a loan from VisionFund and KIVA to buy more merchandise such as earrings, rings, and inexpensive bracelets. She also sells thread and checkered fabrics for sewing, among other things. She says that although these are very simple and small things, it is going very well for her. She comments that she started her business 15 years ago, because Rosy had a great desire to help her husband with the household expenses: "I saw how my husband was working long hours, but we couldn't make ends meet, and we didn't have enough money to cover all of the household expenses and the education of all of our children."  

She started the business in her mother-in-law's house, but her sales were not as favorable as she had hoped, so she decided to move the business to her house. However, in her mother-in-law's house she left behind a nixtamal [corn] mill which is also profitable. Rosy is very happy with her business, and she says that she wants to continue working hard and not abandon it, because currently her biggest difficulty is the competition within her community. Rosy comments: “My biggest dream is to be able to improve the store, because now it is only roofed with sheet metal, and to expand it to sell other items." Rosy also has the desire to buy a small truck and go out to "ranchar" (offer her products in other communities). In this way she will be able to increase her earnings to pay for the household expenses and her children's education. The other members of the group are Gloria, who will invest her loan in chickens and embroidered items; Teresa, who will buy sheep; Martina, who will obtain some turkeys; Miriam, who will invest in pigs; and Catalina, who will buy a nixtamal mill. All of them are very grateful to VisionFund and KIVA for the loan, because it will help them in various ways with their economic activities.

loans.use: to buy beads, earrings, necklaces, rings, checkered fabric, etc.

location.town: San Miguel Agua Bendita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Martha Azucena de 43 años de edad, soltera con tres hijos, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  el servicio de costura ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio una 10 horas elaborando prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones, uniformes, faldas, vestidos, juegos de cama, short. El  objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo es invertir en materia prima como hilos, agujas, cintas, forros, telas, aceite de máquina, encajes, botones, broches. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena is 43 years old. She's single and has three children. She comes from Leon, which is located in the western area of the country. She's known to be hard-working and responsible, with the drive to succeed in her life. In her free time she enjoys spending time with her children. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to complete her education and found herself having to work at an early age. However, she would have liked to have studied to become a nurse.
Thanks to her efforts and her drive to get ahead, she runs a sewing business located in her home. She spends 10 hours a day making garments such as blouses, trousers, uniforms, skirts, gowns, bedding sets and shorts. The purpose of the loan is to get working capital and purchase supplies such as thread, needles, bands, lining, fabric, machine oil, lace, buttons, clasps. That way she'll be able to improve her profits in a not-so-distant future. Martha thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide for people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of livelihood.

loans.use: to get working capital and purchase supplies for making garments, such as thread, needles, bands, lining, fabric, machine oil, lace, buttons, clasps.

loans.name: Paola Janhette

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pequeño hijo, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Paola pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación.
Por iniciativa propia, Paola trabaja como maestra en un centro de educación inicial de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y paciencia con sus alumnos.
Paola se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará prendas de vestir para niños, ya que desea poder venderlas en la época navideña y con ello desea obtener un poco mas de dinero, así pues Paola seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Paola is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her young son. She is a hard-working single mother who dedicates all of her efforts to getting ahead. Thanks to her effort and her parents' support, Paola was able to study for a professional degree in Education. 

On her own initiative, Paola works as a teacher in a primary education center in her city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she believes it is going well for her because of her dedication and her patience with her students. 

Paola is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to her she will be able to buy children's garments to sell. She would like to sell them during the Christmas season, and in this way she would like to obtain a little more money. In this way, Paola will keep working and doing her best in order to achieve her great dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en: Glen is a single entrepreneur who has run a bakery for more than two years for a living. He earns well enough from his business that he was able to help his parents' needs. He borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy raw ingredients for cassava cake catered orders and market demands. Hopefully, Glen wants to improve and expand the bakery for a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cassava cake

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu for the previous loans, which have helped her boost her life and family. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. In addition, she sells a variety of vegetables and tomatoes to supplement her income. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Mrganush village of Ararat region. Her mother is a teacher with many years of experience working at local village school. 

Aida studies at Armenian State Pedagogical University after Kh. Abovyan, she wants to become a teacher like her mother and studies hard to accomplish her goal. Aida's parents hardly manage to cover their family's basic daily needs, so they are not able to cover her university costs. Aida asks for this loan to be able to cover her university tuition and continue her education. She will be very grateful to all her lenders for supporting her.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 42-year-old farmer in Miziira where his tea farm is located. He has been doing tea farming since 2000, and he started tea farming with the purpose of getting a source of income to support his family. 

In addition to tea farming, he grows some coffee on a small scale as a way of supplementing his incomes. He started tea farming mainly because he needed money to support his family, and because he thought that farming would reward him better than all the other businesses. 

He applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX so he can buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of the soil. His clients are mainly tea traders in the area who take the tea to the factories around. 

Unfavorable weather is his major challenge, but he is positive that he will achieve his dream in life of expanding his shamba (a field used for growing crops) and getting enough money to cater to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 67 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the village of Chikaani. Mikheil and his wife are retired. In spite of their age, the couple is actively involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, Mikheil grows grapes, watermelons, and maize on his own piece of land, and sells his harvest seasonally.

Mikheil is now requesting a loan to start an animal business and generate more income. His loan request was approved within the frames of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Mikheil will purchase 8-10 calves. After purchasing the livestock, he will raise and then sell them after several months for a higher price. It will generate an income, and Mikheil will expand his farm in future. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha is a 48-year-old farmer from Prey Veng province. He owns and manages one hectare of farmland for rice cultivation. Farming is the sole source of his household income. To ensure that he has a good rice production, he works hard at the rice field for at least 8 hours a day during a rainy season, and is involved in other activities in a dry season. He earns a normal income of KHR 10,000 per day to cover his daily living needs.

Since he doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, he is unable to help his family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, he has requested a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, he is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of his family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. For five years in this business, Luciano has earned good enough for the family and was able to repay his previous loan successfully. 

Recently, he requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a boat pump machine. In the future, Luciano wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a boat pump machine

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
To generate more income, Remedios engages in cooking and selling of snacks in the school campus. She is 42 years of age and blessed with three children. In the picture she's with her daughter who helps her in the business. 

Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to support the education of her two children. She's requesting for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients like bananas, sweet potatoes, rice cakes, banana wrappers, cooking oil, juice, sugar and seasonings needed in cooking snack foods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like bananas, sweet potatoes, rice cake, banana wrapper, cooking oil, juice, sugar and seasonings

loans.name: Zarzamora Group

texts.es: El grupo “Zarzamora” está integrado por  cuatro integrantes tres mujeres y un hombre todos ellos pertenecen a una comunidad mazahua en la cual aún conservan su lengua materna que es el mazahua, sus trajes típicos, sus fiestas y costumbres, Las personas de la comunidad son muy amables siempre pero sobretodo muy trabajadores la mayoría de ellos se dedican al cultivo de maíz. Don Juan quien es el representante del grupo platica que el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque donde vivía y donde paso toda su infancia había mucha zarzamora era una fruta muy típica en ese lugar aunque en dicho lugar la llaman en su lengua materna “Ro Gu” por eso le pusieron ese nombre. Don Juan tiene 38 años de edad esta casado con la señora Verónica desde hace 19 años juntos han formado una familia con cinco niños de los cuales cuatro de ellos aun se encuentran estudiando. Él se dedica a la cría engorda y venta de borregos desde hace ya 8 años platica que inicio su actividad porque sus borregos se reproducen muy bien y rápido los vende. Los compra desde pequeños para criarlos y engordarlos por seis meses generalmente vende a personas que se dedican a vender barbacoa de borrego. Platica que no tiene ningún problema, trabaja durante todo un año en el cultivo de maíz y avena para tener seguro el alimento de sus borregos. Cuando llegan a enfermar inmediatamente acude con su veterinario para consultar el tratamiento de sus borregos. Don Juan comento “Me gusta mucho mi actividad porque mientras yo trabajo y estoy generando ingresos mi esposa se encarga de cuidarlos para cuando estén grande los puédanos vender y así obtener ingresos extras para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia” Don Juan, María Julia, Hilaria, Rosalinda están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA porque gracias al crédito podrán comprar mas borreguitos
texts.en:
The "Zarzamora" group is made up of three women and one man. All four belong to the Mazahua community which still maintains its native language (Mazahua), typical dress, holidays, and customs. The members of the community are very friendly but, above all, very hardworking. The majority of them earn a living by growing corn. 

Juan, who is the group's representative, says that they chose the name "Zarzamora" for the group due to the fact that the area where he lived and spent his childhood has a lot of Zarzamora, a fruit typical to this region. In the area, the fruit is known as "Ro Gu" in the mother tongue. 

Juan is 38 years old, and has been married to Veronica for 19 years. They have a family of five children, of whom four as still in school. Juan earns a living by fattening and selling sheep. He has been doing this for 8 years, and he says that his sheep reproduce quickly, and they sell fast. He buys them when they are small in order to raise and fatten them, typically for a period of 6 months. He sells them to people who sell the barbecued meat. He hasn't encountered any difficulties. He works during the year to grow corn and oats to ensure that his sheep have food. If they get sick, he takes them immediately to the vet for treatment.

Juan says, "I like this job very much since while I work and earn a living, my wife takes care of the sheep so that when they are fully grown, we can sell them and earn more income to improve our family's quality of life." 

Juan, María Julia, Hilaria, and Rosalinda are very happy and grateful to VisionFund and KIVA, as due to the loan then can buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep and feed.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 58 years old. He is widowed and lives with his grown son in the village of Bodbe. Nodar and his son grow grapes and wheat on their own piece of land and sell their harvest seasonally. Their earnings are very small and hardly enough for feeding expenses.

Nodar is now requesting a loan to start up an animal business and generate more income. His loan request was approved within the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Nodar will purchase 5-6 calves. After purchasing livestock, he will raise them and sell them after several months for a higher price. It will generate an income and Nodar will expand his farm in future. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en:
Valentine is a single woman. She has one kid who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her kid.

She operates a fruits and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of competition in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane helps her husband in managing their own farm for a living. She has been doing this for more than five years, earning well for the family. 

Mary Jane always finds ways to have a greener farm for a better income. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase fertilizer to improve their farm. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Azucena tiene 36 años de edad, su grado de estudios es de primaria completa, madre de dos hijas la primera tiene 15 años y está saliendo de ciclo común básico y tiene pensado estudiar magisterio, la segunda tiene 12 años y ella está en primero de ciclo común básico y quiere seguir estudiando ya que su sueño es ser doctora. Con su propio esfuerzo compro una propiedad y con ella vive el papa, las hijas no se involucran en las actividades de campo ya que ella como madre quiere un mejor futuro para ellas. Doña Azucena se dedica al negocio del cultivo de café desde niña esto porque sus padres le enseñaron adquiriendo los conocimientos requeridos para hacerlo  los cuales los ha aprovechado al máximo. Ella tiene 1 manzana de tierra cultivada y está produciendo café ubicada a 4 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada caminando recibiendo apoyo de un hermano para asistir sus cultivos ya que ella es madre soltera.
Doña Azucena tiene como meta mejorar el estado de sus cultivos de café comprando más tierra y sembrando una mayor cantidad ya que de esa forma ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir comprando más propiedades para heredar a sus hijas. Como Madre apoyar a sus hijas para que puedan cumplir sus sueños de ser profesionales y que no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud vivió.
Por lo que hoy día ella solicita financiamiento para comprar abono, foliares, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para la corta de café y aplicación de insumos ya que de esa manera ella podrá aprovechar al máximo el tiempo y podrá sacarle provecho a su inversión.
texts.en:
Azucena is 36 years old and has an elementary school education.  She is the mother of 2 daughters.  Her eldest is 15 years old and is finishing her basic studies.  She's thinking about studying teaching.  Her younger daughter is 12 years old and is in the first part of the basic studies program.  She wants to continue to study because her dream is to be a doctor.  

With her own efforts, Azucena bought a property and her father lives with her.  Her daughters are not involved in the farming activities, because she, as a mother, wants a better future for them.  Azucena has been working cultivating coffee ever since she was a child.  Her parents taught her the knowledge required to grow coffee, and she's taken advantage of this to the maximum.  She has 1 manzana of land (about 1.75 acres) under cultivation, and it is producing coffee.  The land is located 4 kilometers from her house, and she gets there by walking.  She receives support from a brother in cultivating the crops, because she is a single mother.

Azucena has goals of improving the condition of her coffee crops, buying more land, and planting a greater quantity of plants, because in this way she could increase her income and continue to buy more property for her daughters' inheritance.  As a mother, she support her daughters so that they can accomplish their dreams of becoming professionals and avoid the same situation that she found herself in when she was young.

Azucena is now requesting a loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, foliar spray (leaf fertilizer), and to pay for workers to cut the coffee and apply the products.  This way, she will be able to make the best use of her time and get the best results from her investment.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to tend to her coffee crops

loans.name: Dafina

texts.en:
Dafina is a 41-year-old married mother of three children, who are 18, 10 and 6. She lives in the northern part of the country, and livestock has been her primary type of activity for the past 12 years.

Dafina is applying for a loan for the first time, and she wants to build a stable with it. “The cold has just started and I’ve got to hurry up and build a stable for my animals. The heavy rains and the storms have almost destroyed what I had previously built very primitively for them. Other than promising lenders that I will pay them back and that I will appreciate their help immensely, I can’t say much at this point. I need their help,” Dafina is quoted as saying.

loans.use: to build a stable.

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhbayar, 31 years old, lives with her mother and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They reside in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

She has been rendering taxi service to local people for five years. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her elder daughter studies at high school, while her younger daughter stays at home with her grandma. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT [Mongolian tugriks] to buy automobile spare parts such as a cooling fan, tires, brakes and motor in order to repair her automobile, because this automobile is the only income source for her whole family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Sarvan

texts.en:
Sarvan is 39 years old, married for 14 years, and has two children. His son is 12 years old and in year 5, his daughter is 10 and in year 3 at school.  Sarvan’s wife is a seller in the local market. His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now living in Baku region. 

Sarvan has a “chayxana”, which is translated into English as a tea house. In this picture, Sarvan serves tea to a customer. Today Sarvan needs a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to repair the kitchen of his chayxana. Sarvan is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his chayxana and monthly income.

loans.use: to repair the kitchen of his tea house

loans.name: Saveurn

texts.en:
Saveurn is a resident living in Kandal province. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Recently, she has been living separately from her husband due to unavoidable family circumstances, so she lives with her children. Saveurn is a garment worker who works 8-10 hours a day and earns a normal salary of USD $70 per month. She has been in this occupation since 2008. To help Saveurn earn additional income, her oldest son works as a paid laborer in the construction industry.

As her family doesn’t have a motorcycle for commuting to their workplaces, Saveurn is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 U.S. dollars to buy a used motorcycle. This purchase will allow her to minimize daily expenses, since she is paying for motor-taxi service for commuting to work, and to save for future emergencies of her family.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Jose no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Jose trabaja en su pequeña carpintería, el elabora puertas, mesas, sillas y otros, Jose trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar las paredes y ponerle piso de concreto a su hogar, así pues Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a 42-year-old man. He lives in the city of Ica with his wife and two children. He is very hard-working and enthusiastic, and he dedicates all of his efforts to helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, because of the lack of economic resources, and the need to work starting at a young age, Jose was not able to study for a professional degree. 

On his own initiative, Jose works in his small carpentry shop. He makes doors, tables, chairs and other items. Jose works every day for approximately 10 hours, and he believes it is going well for him because of his dedication and effort. 

Jose is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him, he will be able to carry out improvements to his home. He wants to reinforce the walls and lay a concrete floor in his home. In this way, Jose will keep working and exerting himself to achieve his great dream of having a secure and appropriate place for his family to live.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is 60 years old and a mother of three. She lives in a rural community with her children and makes her living through farming. She sells snacks to the passengers at the bus station to have an additional source of income. Being a hard working mother, she aims to continue and strengthen her business. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more coconut pie, coconut juice, and boiled corn to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy more coconut  pie, coconut juice, and boiled corn to sell.

loans.name: Ligia Hiomaly

texts.es:
Ligia Hiomaly de 20 anos, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en occidente, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Ella  se esfuerza mucho, para superarse en la vida  a pesar de las dificultades económica por la que atraviesa su  familia, decidió seguir estudiando y trabajando a la vez, para ser alguien en la vida y tener un mejor futuro.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos plasticos como termos, panas, valdes y cosméticos de forma ambulante, como sombra de ojos, rubor, marbellines, delineador, anti ojeras, antiarrugas, hidratante, perfumes, body, labiales, Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Ligia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Ligia Hiomaly is 20 years old and comes from Leon, which is located in the west. She's known to be hard-working and responsible, with the drive to succed in her life. She works very hard to succeed in life, in spite of the financial hardships that her family has been going through. She decided to continue studying and working at the same time, so that she can make something of herself and have a brighter future.

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to get ahead, she runs a door-to-door business selling plastic products such as thermos, buckets and other items, as well as cosmetics such as eye shadow, blush, beauty products, eyeliner, under eye concealers, anti-wrinkle cream, moisturizer, perfume, body stockings and lipstick. She works 10 hours a day offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to get working capital and stock her business, so that she can improve her profits in a not-so-distant future. Ligia thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a decent means of livelihood.

loans.use: get working capital and stock her business with plastic products such as thermos, buckets and other items, as well as cosmetics such as eye shadow, blush, beauty products, eyeliner, under eye concealers, anti-wrinkle cream, moisturizer, perfume, body stockings and lipstick.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre de 27 años es soltero,vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Alberto pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía.
Por iniciativa propia, Alberto trabaja como técnico de campo en una empresa publica de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Alberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda comprará prendas de vestir para poder venderlos en la época navideña, de esta manera podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos, así pues Alberto seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Alberto is a single, 27-year-old man. He lives in the town of Pucallpa. He's very hard-working and enthusiastic, and makes every effort to get ahead. Thanks to his efforts and his parents' support, Alberto was able to study for a career in agronomy.
On his own initiative, Alberto works as a field technician for a state company of his town. He works every day for about 10 hours and believes that he does well because of his dedication and his good performance.
Alberto is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he'll be able to purchase garments so he can sell them during Christmas season. That way he'll be able to obtain a little more profit, and therefore Alberto will continue to work and strive to achieve his biggest dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to purchase garments for selling.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura sells fruits and green vegetables. In addition she also has a retail shop where sells household consumables to supplement her income. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.

She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and fruits for resale

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
This is Vicky, 27, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, an installer, and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their own household, and she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Vicky makes and sells rice cakes and rice dishes. These are foods commonly eaten for snacks and sometimes after meal for desserts. She sells it per order and it is in demand on special occasions and holidays.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy different ingredients needed in making dainties like rice, flour, sugar, coconut and other ingredients. 

Vicky dreams that her business will grow bigger and last longer. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, flour, sugar and coconut

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a business man in one of the cells in Igara East, Bushenyi District. He operates a shop which he started in 2003. He started the retail business with the objective of getting a reliable source of income in order to look after his family with ease. He is also involved in agriculture on a small scale in an effort to earn money to look after his children. He would like to use the loan to buy more stock so that he can serve his customers with the required quality and quantity of stock. His clients are mainly the local people in his cell, and he says they have supported him greatly. His future hopes include becoming financially stable and giving his children the very best. He is hopeful that he will attain this if he is given the loan money amounting to 1,000,000 UGX.

loans.use: to buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina lives in the Senaki district. She is 52 years old, married and lives with her daughter, son-in-law, grandchild and husband. The source of income for the family is an agricultural business. They breed four milk cows and make cheese which is sold at the local open market. 

Tina and her husband, Rauli, decided to start a new business as their existing income wasn't enough for the family. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provisions of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the loan, Tina will purchase a car and Rauli will serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase, and they will be able to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car and start a Taxi business

loans.name: Mirna Evelin

texts.es:
Mirna, es casada, tiene un hijo de 9 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo, no poseen familiares en el extranjero, se dedica a trabajar de forma independiente como fisioterapeuta, tiene un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., por su experiencia no tiene dificultades en ejercerlo, además se capacita para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
Invertirá en la compra de un laser con lo que espera tener lo necesario para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes, atraer a más clientes y tener un aumento en sus ganancias, para cancelar la deuda y seguir ampliando su negocio.
Su sueño es darle estudios universitarios a su hija, para que tenga un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mirna is married and has a nine year old child.  She lives with her husband and child and has no family in foreign countries.  She works on her own as a physical therapist and has a 7:00 am to 5:00 pm schedule.  With her experience she doesn’t have any problems and she also trains to provide better service.

She will use the money from this loan to buy a laser so that she will have what she needs to provide quality service, attract more customers, and increase her earnings so she can repay the debt and expand her business.

Her dream is to provide a university education to her daughter, so she can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a laser.

loans.name: Le Bon Berger De Sable Group

texts.fr:
Roseline est le coordinatrice de son groupe Le Bon Berger de Sable. Elle est mariée elle a 4 enfants. Elle habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité n’est rare et de l’eau portable n’est très limite.  Elle dispose d'un salon de beauté.

Elle dirige son commerce de salon de beaute pendants les 8 dernières années. Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera a grandir son commerce. Des autres membres Le Bon Berger de Sable ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel ques ventes produits de cosmétiques, charbon, boissons gazeuses etc. 

Elle déclare que son défi principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante dans le département du nord est. Elle dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera a construire une grande maison avec l’aide d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en:
Roseline is the coordinator of her group "Le Bon Berger de Sable". She is married and has four children. She lives in northern Haiti, where electricity is rare and potable water is very limited. She has a beauty salon.

She has been running her beauty salon for the last eight years. She hopes this loan will help her to expand her business. Other members of Le Bon Berger de Sable have need of a loan for businesses, such as selling cosmetic products, charcoal, carbonated beverages, etc. 

She says that her main challenge is to become a greater merchant in the northeast district. She says her main goal is to have a big business that will facilitate the construction of a big house, with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to purchase beauty and hair products

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.en: Mahmadullo was born in 1953 year. He is a hardworking man who always tries to improve living condition for his family. He has been busy with taxi service more than 20 years. Mahmadullo lives and works in the South part of Tajikistan. His working day began at 6 o’clock and lasted till late night. Mahmadullo has great experience in this field. He works hard but he makes a little income. Mahmadullo must organize the marriage party of his son but he has not enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to make wedding party. He awaits your support.

loans.use: organize his son's wedding party

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola, de 65 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos y su nieto en su casa propia. El trabajo de Lola consiste en la venta de productos comestibles. Tiene su pequeño negocio instalado en su casa, se dedica a tiempo completo a cumplir esta función y se siente muy contenta por sus ventas. Trabaja sola mientras realiza algunas funciones básicas en su hogar. Abastece su negocio de manera semanal comprando en los centros comerciales del centro de la ciudad con la ayuda de su hijo. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace 5 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que produce sus ingresos económicos sin que esto le demande un excesivo esfuerzo, además tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a su pequeño nieto con sus tareas escolares. Le esta yendo bien ya que tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, espera poder ampliar su negocio y empezar a ahorrar para invertir en un futuro en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Con El monto solicitado de S/. 3000 comprara productos comestibles tales como 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, cajas de leche chica, pan, huevos, aceites, plátano, cebollas, harina, galletas, conservas de atún, embutidos y otros productos.
texts.en: Lola is 65 years old and a very hard-working woman. She's single and has two children. She lives with them and her grandson in a house that she owns. Lola's line of work is selling foodstuffs. She owns her small business which is set up in her home. She works on this trade full-time and she's very happy with her sales. She works alone and at the same time she does some basic household chores. She stocks her business on a weekly basis by going shopping with her son in the commercial centres downtown. She has been in this line of work for five years. What she enjoys about her work is that it yields profits without her having to work too hard. Besides, she has time to help her little grandson with his schoolwork. She has been doing well, since she makes good profits which allow her to make her repayments in a timely fashion. She hopes to be able to expand her business and start saving so that in the future she can invest in home improvements. With the requested amount of 3,000 nuevos soles she'll purchase foodstuffs such as a bag of rice, a bag of sugar, small milk cartons, bread, eggs, cooking oil, plantains, onions, flour, crackers, canned tuna, cold cuts and other merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. Thy is a primary school teacher in a local school of Pursat province. She teaches small children, who are between the age of 6 and 13 years old. Thy is able to earn a decent income, but it is hardly enough to cover her daily costs.,So, Thy also works as a part-time teacher to earn additional income. She has been in this occupation for more than 15 years.

Since Thy doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. For this reason, she has requested a loan of US $1,000 dollars to build a household latrine and buy its accessories. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, Thy is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its accessories.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 40s, is married and has five children who are still going to school.  She has been running two businesses, selling fried fish and fresh milk for three years now. She works from 4 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy more fish and milk to resell. She has a dream of owning a hotel.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Unity," which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and milk to resell.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel is 33 years old lives with her husband and 3 children in a traditional nomadic yurt in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband Monhbold sells firewood and charcoal in local market. Her older 2 children study at local schools and youngest daughter goes to local kindergarten. 
Narangerel has been running small meat products sales business in local market since 2003 with her husband. In order to increase family income her husband started firewood and charcoal retail business. She is now requesting loan of 3,000,000MNT to purchase large amount of meat products from herders and sell at her counter to local residents. She is hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders and sell at her counter to local residents

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money for business expansion. 

Janepher is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables and bananas for resale. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables and bananas  for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El señor David  tiene 31 años de edad, vive en concubinato desde hace 6 años al norte de Colomi, tiene un hijo dependiente que aún está estudiando. Es agricultor y cultiva en terreno de sus padres con rotación de cultivos, su fuente de ingresos proviene de la venta de papa y locoto, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado vacuno. Por la falta de recursos económicos solicita un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico  y productos agroquímicos, porque sus cultivos que están en proceso necesitan mantenimiento  y control fitosanitario, así podrá tener un cultivo sano con mejores resultados de producción.
texts.en: David is 31 years old and has lived with a partner for 6 years to the north of Colomi.  He has a dependent child who is still in school.  David is a farmer who cultivates on his parent's land, rotating crops.  His source of income comes from the sale of potatoes and locoto peppers.  He also has some cattle. Because he lacks financial resources, he is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products.  He needs these because his crops that are in progress need maintenance and phytosanitary control.  This way, he will have a healthy crop and a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and agrochemical products

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With this loan, she is requesting Kshs 20,000 to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she is appreciative for the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Anabel tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y legumbres en diferentes tianguis desde hace 15 años.

Anabel pone su puesto en diferentes tianguis de sábados a jueves, descansando los viernes. Trabajan con ella cinco jóvenes que le ayudan con la venta de verduras y legumbres.  Pide este préstamo para mejorar su casa, la cual requiere instalación de puertas, ventanas y algunos acabados.
 
Gracias a su trabajo Anabel ha logrado estar estable con su familia en lo general, aunque con algunas altas y bajas. Su reto es seguir adelante con su negocio, dar trabajo a más gente y en su momento le gustaría tener un negocio en un lugar fijo; ya no estar en tianguis.  Le interesa abrir su cremería o verdulería.
texts.en:
Anabel is a Kubo Financiero customer, and this is her story:
She is 39 years old, and married with three children. She has fifteen years of experience in the business of selling greens and other vegetables in different open-air markets.

Anabel sets up her stall in different markets from Saturday to Thursday and rests on Friday.  Five young people work with her and help her sell her vegetables. She is requesting this loan to improve her home, which needs windows and doors to be installed. This work is nearly done.

Thanks to her work, Anabel has managed a measure of security for her family in general, although there have been some highs and lows. Her goal is to continue getting ahead with her business, provide work for more people, and one day to have a business set up in a fixed location instead of working in the open-air markets. She is interested in opening a dairy or produce shop.

loans.use: improve her home by installing doors and windows.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz, age 37, is a married woman and the mother of two children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will help her to meet the increasing demands of her customers on time. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 44 year old vigorous lady, and she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old vigorous lady and the mother of three children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, Saima requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier income. Saima is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en:
Kouser is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Kouser is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health.

To make her store fully stocked, Kouser requested a loan of PKR 20,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en:
Noeurn is a 48-year-old married man. His family consists of him, his wife and three children. Together, they live in a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province.  To be a responsible father and a breadwinner of the family, Noeurn is involved in farming and construction. He commonly grows rice in the rainy season and works at construction sites during the dry season. Asides from his hardships, Noeurn is able to provide enough food for the household and send his children to school.

His current house has deteriorated over the years, Noeurn is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 4,000,000 to buy woods for home renovations. He hopes that he will be able to provide a suitable living condition for his family members through the loan support. Noeurn expresses his thanks to all lenders who have contributed their loan to help poor fellow like him to develop his living status.

loans.use: to buy wood for home renovations.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
This is Flordeliza, 46, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Flordeliza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells herbal medicine and religious items for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Flordeliza dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zohidjon

texts.en:
Zohidjon is married and has children. He has always wanted to provide them with a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 5 years ago began own business with driving. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, now that her children are able to get a good education and the financial challenges are being solved little by little. He is asking for a loan to repair his car. 
In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income which allowed him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza es una mujer muy amable siempre esta de muy buen humor pero sobretodo es una persona muy trabajadora muy dedicada a su trabajo, tiene 44 años de edad está casada  desde hace 25 años con el señor Rosendo quien trabaja en su propio taxi, juntos formaron una familia con tres hijos de los cuales ya ninguno depende de dicha pareja. Doña Esperanza se dedica a la elaboración de gorros, bufandas, guantes, capas, calentadores y medias  de estambre desde hace 38 años plática que desde  los 7 años tenía un gran deseo por iniciar a bordar pero no tenia material para aprender sin embargo se las ingenio para tener un estambre. “Un día tome un suéter y unas tijeras de mi mamá, busque un buen lugar para esconderme y cortar el suéter de mi mamá y así obtener estambre, el gancho ya lo tenia me lo encontré en la calle rumbo a mi escuela” Doña Esperanza estaba muy contenta porque ya tenia estambre, pero su mamá se encontraba disgustada  porque era su suéter favorito y Doña Esperanza lo había destruido. “Mi mamá me regaño por lo que había hecho, pero finalmente me compro estambres de colores para iniciar a bordar”. En ese momento no sabía bordar pero aprendió de unos familiares que también se dedicaban a la elaboración de artesanía toan solo con verlos. Cuando ya tenía varias piezas a esa misma edad inicio a salir a las ciudades grandes para vender su artesanía y con sus primeras ganancias le repuso el suéter a su mamá. Y desde entonces se ha dedicado a elaborar productos bordados para la temporada de fríos todo el año trabajan pero las épocas buenas son en el invierno desde hace 6 años está fuera de su casa por una temporada larga porque en el lugar donde vive sus artesanías se las pagan muy baratas y en otros lugares es mejor remunerada. Esta vez están solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA  para comprar estambre y también más mercancía pero de otro material porque también se los solicitan sus clientes porque no les gusta el estambre, porque muchas veces si alguno de sus clientes le solicita un articulo especial necesita elmaterial, la combinación y modelos son creatividad de Doña esperanza  para realizar alguna prenda solo necesita de algunos minutos para tenerlos listos.
