Erik is 33 years old, and he lives in Kapan city, which is in the Syunik region. Erik lives with his parents and his brother. He works as a grinder and because of his cut work, he is a famous master in his region. Erik’s father is a builder, and very often they work together on one and the same building’s construction. His mother is a housewife and his brother is engaged in farming. Erik is still not married, but he has a very nice girlfriend to whom he has made a proposal, and now she is ready to be his bride.  

Erik asks a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams, which together with his savings, will help him to organize his wedding party.

loans.use: to organize his wedding party

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is a farmer from Aragats village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 6-year-old daughter, and his parents. To be able to take care of his family, Gagik is extensively engaged in agribusiness. With the help of his family members Gagik cultivates potatoes, cabbage, cucumbers, greens and strawberries. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. 

To be able to continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gagik needs to make some investments. A loan of $3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase cellophane and cable for greenhouse construction, and to buy potato seeds. Gagik and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and cable for greenhouse construction, and to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Elizabeth from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is single with no child for now.  For the past six years, Elizabeth has had an established medical drugs business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself.  She works at the business from 8 AM  until 7 PM, seven days per week. She is very hard-working and desires to improve her standard of living

Elizabeth requires a loan in order to purchase medical drugs such as blood syrup (medicine for anemia), malarial drugs, and pain tablets to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family welfare and increase her business. In the future, Elizabeth plans to open a big cosmetic shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase medical drugs such as blood syrup (medicine for anemia), malarial drugs, and pain tablets to expand her business.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 37-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two children, one son and one daughter. Sami works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Sami and his wife would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the things they need. 

Sami took a USD Murabaha (suitable for Muslim borrowers) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Sami will be able to provide pure water for his children since the water in his area is not clean. Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Mixdalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mixdalia tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por venta de comida preparada, ubicad a dos horas de Piura una región Peruana conocida por su exquisita gastronomía.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza y piqueos preparados por ella misma, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cerveza e insumos para la elaboración de piqueos y una segunda parte para equipar su negocio con la compra de mesas y sillas y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mixdalia, 26, lives with her husband in the district of Buenos Aires.  The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.  This is a community, well-known for selling ready-made meals, which is two hours away from Piura, a region of Peru known for its delicious cuisine.

She sells beer and snacks which she prepares herself and then sells from her own home.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy beer and ingredients to make these appetizers and also to equip her business with chairs and tables.  In this way she hopes to get more business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beer, chairs and tables to equip her business.

loans.name: Kima

texts.en:
Kima impetuously wants to have her third deal with Kiva. She is still running her clothes trading business; she sells men's, women's and children's clothes at a rented store. She is a successful businesswoman and has many customers. She has been in this business for 13 years already. Her business income gave her a chance to pay for her daughters’ education, organize their wedding parties, and construct a new house. 

Kima lives in Ijevan city, which is in Tavush region, with her husband and son. Her two daughters are already married and live with their families. Her last two loans she has taken were for her business, and this third one she will use for it as well.

She asks for a loan of 3,000 US Dollars in order to buy a lot of winter season clothes and have a good sale near Christmas and New Year holidays period.

loans.use: to buy winter season clothes.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram is a young farmer from Tsaghkalanj village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, 7-year-old son, his mother and brother. To take care of his family’s needs, Vahram is engaged in breeding livestock (cows, oxen, piglets), and in the cultivation of potatoes, cabbage, cucumber, tomatoes, greens, strawberries and grapes. With the help of his brother, Vahram sells the agricultural products in the local market. The latter is the main source of the family’s income. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Vahram needs a loan of USD $3,000 to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane and cable), to buy some forage for the livestock, to purchase potato seeds, and to make previous credit repayments. Vahram and his family rely on the good will of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for greenhouse construction (cellophane and cable), to buy some forage for the livestock, to purchase potato seeds, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is 25 years old and lives in the suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi, with his wife, two children, and in-laws. Revaz is employed at a local distribution company as a driver, and gets a small-sized monthly salary. His earnings are modest and hardly enough to cover household expenses. That is why Revaz decided to start an additional business in his city and generate more funds.

He owns a car and is now requesting a loan to change his car’s fuel system from petrol to gas, which is cheaper than petrol, and start a taxi business. This will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent, and Revaz will generate a good income. It will allow him to offer his clients low prices for the service, which will attract many customers. 

With the received amount, he will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for his family's well being.

loans.use: to change his car's fuel system and start a taxi business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, de 31 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, es madre de una niña de 8 años a quien cría en la casa de su mamá. Consuelo se dedica a la venta de pollos. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados mas concurridos por la población, afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias ya que su lugar de trabajo esta muy bien ubicado en una esquina visible de la calle, pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio ya que para conseguir los buenos y frescos productos que ofrece a sus clientes tiene que madrugar hasta los centros de abastos de pollos para adelantarse a otros vendedores que compiten en este mismo sector. Ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario para estar cómoda. Lleva en este negocio más de 4 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso. Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio. Este es el préstamo grupal número 08 con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
El monto solicitado de S/. 3000 lo invertirá en la compra de pollos de las mejores tamaños.
texts.en:
Consuelo, 31, is a hard-working young woman and mother of an 8-year-old girl, who she raises in her mother’s house.  Consuelo sells chickens from a stall in one of the busiest markets in the area.  Fortunately, she sells a lot and generates a lot of income as her stall is visibly well located on the corner of one of the streets.

This job requires a lot of sacrifice because in order to offer her customers the freshest and best quality produce, she has to get up early to buy the best chickens at the food markets and get ahead of her competitors.  She feels that all the effort is rewarded and worth it when she sees that her little girl has all that she needs.  

She has been in this business for four years, she works alone and she tells us that her desire to do things well and to generate income for her family are her motives to keep growing.  She enjoys the freedom that this venture gives her as she can spend the afternoons playing or doing sport as well as being with her family.  She hopes she can continue seeing her business grow.  

This is the group’s eighth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support that allows her to move forward.  She is also committed to paying off the loan on time.  The total she is asking for is 3,000 nuevos soles which she will use to buy the best chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Lyuba

texts.en:
Lyuba is an experienced farmer from Baghramyan village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband. Lyuba is employed in the government sector; she works at the village local school as a technician. She is the main breadwinner of the family. Her salary, however, is so low that she cannot afford a living based on that salary alone. To be able to take care of their needs, Lyuba, with the help of her husband, is engaged in breeding livestock (pig, cows) and in viniculture. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. The latter is the most important source of income for the family. 

As life is getting more expensive day by day, Lyuba needs to expand her agribusiness in order to be able to make ends meet. A loan of USD $2,500 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase a cow, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments. Lyuba and her husband highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, to buy some forage for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is an experienced farmer from Griboyedov village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law, and two granddaughters (4 and 1 year old). To be able to take care of his family, Samvel is engaged in breeding livestock (piglets), in plant cultivation in greenhouses and in the cultivation of alfalfa. With the help of his sons, Samvel sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. 

Samvel's agribusiness currently needs some investments in order to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD $1,500 will support Samvel and his family greatly enabling him to purchase cellophane and bottles for construction of new greenhouses, and to make previous credit repayments. Samvel and his large family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase cellophane and bottles for the construction of new greenhouses, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 29 years old and lives in the village of Gandzakar, which is in the Tavush region. Arman is married and has a lovely new born son, three months of age. He lives with his parents. Arman, together with his mother, are engaged in farming and agriculture. In their farm they have one heifer, four piglets, and twenty chickens. They also cultivate a plot of land, which gives harvest of apple, persimmon, and peach; they cultivate beans as well. They also sell meat and eggs, which they also use for their family needs. 

Arman has a truck on which he makes private cargo transportation, but his truck is a very old one and sometimes half way, it may become out of order.  
Arman asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) in order to buy a new truck, which will help him have more orders and work faster, with more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new truck to use for cargo transportation.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba de 41 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad, es originaria de león, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudios básicos y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su casa de habitación, la rutina de trabajo  de Alba es de unas 10 horas diaria, se levanta desde muy temprano a nizquesar y moler el maíz para la preparación de las tortillas, actividad que la realiza con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima como el quintal de maíz, leña, bolsas, cal, fósforos. Alba agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alba, 41, a single mother with three young children, comes from León in the west of her country.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman who is always looking to improve.  Unfortunately, due to lack of money, she could not finish high school and had to work from an early age so she could contribute to household expenses.  Now she is striving every day to provide her children with a better standard of living.

As a result of her effort and determination she has a business from her own home making and selling tortillas.  She works ten hours a day, getting up very early to prepare and grind the corn to use for the tortillas, but she does this with pleasure.  She is asking for a loan to invest in work capital and supply her business with basic materials such as a corn in bulk, firewood, bags, lime and matches.

Alba is grateful for the help Kiva investors give to people in poor countries who haven’t got much money because it helps them have a respectable  job.

loans.use: to invest in work material and to buy basic goods for making tortillas such as corn, firewood, bags, lime and matches.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush lives in Sevan city which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has a son. 

Sirush considers her first deal with Kiva lenders successful and she wishes to cooperate for the second time. She is still doing well in her trading business in which she has worked for ten years already; she sells men's and women's clothes, shoes, and boots. She works at the city wholesale market in a rented stall. She usually brings her merchandise from Yerevan city and sometimes from Georgia as well. 

Her husband is very thankful to Sirush for her great support, since her business income helps them to solve many financial problems of their family, which would be just impossible with a small income such as a taxi driver like Sirush’s husband earns. 

Sirush asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to enlarge the men's clothes assortment, and also to increase the women's winter boots assortment, since it is in great demand among her loyal customers.

loans.use: to enlarge her men's clothes assortment, and also to increase her women's winter boots assortment since it is in great demand among her loyal customers

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is an experienced agronomist from Tegh village in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, daughter, and school-aged son. Gayane’s husband is employed in the private sector and is the main breadwinner of the family. 

To assist her husband in earning a living for the family, Gayane is engaged in breeding a livestock of sheep and in cultivation of alfalfa. The livestock consists of 150 sheep. Gayane’s family members help her greatly in selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of income for the family. 

As life is getting more expensive on a day-to-day basis, Gayane wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to more effectively meet her family’s needs. A loan of $3000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 28 new sheep for the livestock. Gayane and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 28 new sheep for her livestock

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is an experienced farmer from Verishen village of the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband, school-aged son, and her elderly pensioner mother-in-law. She and her husband work in the government sector; they work as teachers at the village local school. Unfortunately their salaries are not enough to cover their daily needs. 

To be able to take care of the family's needs Svetlana is also engaged in cattle breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivation of grass and alfalfa. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market. As the family's needs are growing with time, Svetlana wants to expand her agribusiness in order to more effectively meet the family's needs. 

She needs a loan of $3000 to purchase three cows. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution in the past, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Svetlana has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Svetlana and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three cows

loans.name: Liuza

texts.en:
Liuza, 63, lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and two school-age grandchildren in the Samtredia district. The source of income for the family is a small-sized agricultural business. Specifically, Liuza breeds three milk cows, and in the grazing season, when cows milk well, Liuza makes cheese for selling as well as family consumption. 

In order to generate stable monthly income on her own, Liuza decided to start up a grocery store near her house, but she found she didn’t have enough money to do so. With a loan of 2,500 GEL, Liuza will purchase a stock of basic groceries such as rice, salt, sugar, oil, etc., to start a store. Liuza owns commercial space so she will save rental costs. She will work as a salesperson herself and serve the clients in a friendly way. Liuza is a very determined lady and hopes her project will be lucrative. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sandra Rosibel

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene una hija, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura junto a su familia, lleva un año de hacer sus propios cultivos de arroz, siendo esta su generación de ingresos. La producción es de buena calidad y es vendida en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, herbicidas y otros insumos para dar asistencia al cultivo de arroz, con el propósito de sacar mejor producción. Su plan es poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en: Sandra, 22, has a daughter and lives with her husband in the municipality of El Negrito in Yoro.  She has always worked in agriculture with her family.  She has been growing her own rice for the past year, which allows her to generate some income.  Her produce is of good quality and it is sold at the local market.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in fertilizer, fungicides, herbicides and other supplies to help her cultivate rice and produce more.  Her desire for the future is to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides and other supplies to help her grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wedding dresses and necklaces and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 31 years old and he lives in the village of Achajur which is in the Tavush region. He has a lovely and large family; he lives with his parents, his wife, and his two children. 

Karen and his father used to work in the Russian Federation for several years, but now Karen is back with his family although his father still works there and temporarily sends some money to the family. 

Karen has a car of his own with which he gives taxi services around the village and the nearby cities, but, as he says, living in the village it is just impossible not to be engaged in farming and agriculture, which in its turn brings some money and it also provides his family with fresh and healthy food. 

Karen is engaged in swine breeding and in land cultivation. He sells meat and also beans and some fruits (apple, plum, peach) from his garden. The coming of winter make Karen get worried about his piglets, of which there are twelve on his farm.

He asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several piglets and a lot of fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and a lot of fodder for them

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Эту скромную и милую леди зовут Нигина. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. У нее есть 2 сына. Муж Нигины находится на заработках заграницей. Нигина живет с двумя сыновьями и работает портнихой у себя дома. Она берет заказы на шитье национальной женской одежды. Такой деятельностью она занимается с 18 лет. Она очень любит свою работу и хочет заниматься такой деятельностью еще много лет. Для Нигины в ее работе нравиться сам процесс работы и результаты, которых она в процессе добивается. Нигина любит смотреть на восторженные лица своих клиенток, после того как они надевают заказанные платья. 
  На сегодняшний день швейная машинка Нигины не пригодна для использования. И она хочет на деньги от кредита купить новую машинку, чтобы поскорее приступить к работе.
texts.en:
This modest and nice lady's name is Nigina. She is 30 years old. She is married and has two sons. Nigina's husband is now working aborad. Nigina lives with her two sons and works as a seamstress at home. She takes in orders to sew traditional women's clothing. She has been in this business since she was eighteen years old. She loves her work very much and wants to continue to do it for many years. Nigina likes the work process and the results which she gets in the process of her work. Nigina loves to see the excited faces of her customers after they wear their custom made dresses.

Today Nigina's sewing machine is not suitable for use. She wants to use the loan money to buy a new sewing machine so she can resume work very soon.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is a 35-year-old man who unfortunately recently lost his wife. He has 5 children who all go to school. In 2000 he started commercial farming in order to earn school fees for his children. He is a farmer who grows beans and maize as well as raising cattle. He has asked for 3,000,000 to buy a few more cows.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is from Lukashin village in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and one-year-old son. She works as a teacher at the local school, and her husband works at the village local self-governance body. Both of them work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully cover the increasing needs of the family. To be able to meet those needs Gohar, with help from her husband is also engaged in agribusiness; they cultivate cabbage and tomatoes, and sell the agricultural products at the local market. The latter is an important source of their income. Gohar currently wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet the needs of her family more effectively. A loan of USD 3000 will support this young hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase six steers, and to pay for harvesting services. Gohar and her husband rely highly on the good will of the lenders and appreciate their support in raising the needed amount to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase six steers, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.ru: Гулнигор до сих пор занимается продажей традиционных лепешек. Три года назад она брала первый кредит для своей деятельности, который был успешно профинансирован со стороны Кредиторов KIVA за что она благодарна. Гулнигор сегодня снова обратилась за кредитом для купли и продажи лепешек. За счет прибыли с торговли она помогает матери обеспечивать их семью. Гулнигор надеется, что Кредиторы KIVA и в этот раз поддержат ее.
texts.en: Up to the present, Gulnigor has been in the business of selling traditional lepyoshki (Central Asian bread). Three years ago, she took out the first loan for her business. This loan was successfully financed by Kiva lenders, for which she is grateful. Today, Gulnigor is requesting a loan again for the purchase and sale of lepyoshki. She uses the profits from her retail business to help her mother provide for their family. Gulnigor hopes that Kiva lenders will help her this time around.

loans.use: to buy and sell lepyoshki (Central Asian bread).

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Эту милую и очаровательную женщину зовут Дилфуза. Она умелая швея. Ей 23 года. Дилфуза замужем, но детей пока не имеет. Она живет с мужем, свекровью, свекром, а также братьями и сестрами мужа в селе города Истаравшан. Дилфуза наравне мужа зарабатывает на жизнь. Она у себя дома принимает заказы на шитьё женских национальных платьев. Дилфуза занимается швейным делом около 5 лет. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом. Дилфуза хочет закупить красивые сезонные ткани для шитья платьев.
texts.en: This lovely and charismatic woman's name is Dilfuza. She is a talented seamstress. She is 23 years old. Dilfuza is married, but she does not have any children yet. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and father-in-law as well as her husband's brothers and sisters in a village in Istaravshan city. Dilfuza earns a living on par with her husband. At her house, she takes orders for sewing women's national dresses. Dilfuza has been in the sewing business for about five years. Now she is requesting a loan. Dilfuza wants to buy beautiful seasonal fabric to sew dresses with.

loans.use: to buy fabric for sewing dresses.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: José, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside con su esposa y sus hijos en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, al cultivo de granos básicos, produce maíz y frijoles. La producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos para la familia. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para darle asistencia a los cultivos, lo que ha permitido sacar buenas cosechas.  Actualmente solicita otro por 6,000 lempiras para limpieza y abono del cultivo de maíz, para mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es aumentar la producción y obtener ingresos para sacar a su familia adelante y darles estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: José is 40 years old, married, has five children, and lives with his wife and children in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  He has worked in farming his whole life, growing staple crops.  He grows corn and beans.  He sells his produce in the area's local market.  This business is his family's source of income.  He has taken out several loans to care for his crops, which has allowed him to reap good harvests.  He is currently requesting another loan for 6,000 lempiras to clean and fertilize his corn crop, which will improve his harvest.  His plan is to increase his yield and earn profits to get his family ahead and provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to clean and fertilize his corn crop

loans.name: Visitación

texts.es:
Visitación es un hombre de 57 años de edad.  Se de dedica a la agricultura en pequeño desde hace 27 años, comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura con su padre, luego con el tiempo fue aprendiendo el trabajo de su madre en el destazo, y desde entonces se dedica al negocio y a la agricultura.

  Él tiene un familia que esta conformada por su esposa, que se dedica a la venta de pupusas y amburguesas en un cafetin a la orilla de la carretera principal,hacia la ciudad y también tienen una hija y un hijo que actualmente viven en los Estados Unidos.
    
El señor Visitación se dedica al destazo de cerdos los días lunes y el resto de la semana se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene experiencia en el destazo de cerdos de 15 años,  decidió seguir en el negocio motivado por los resultados en las ganancias y de esta forma aportar un mayor beneficio económico a su hogar.

El crédito otorgado sera invertido, en el negocio del destazo y en el cafetin que administra su esposa, ellos podrán tener un cafetin mas surtido y de la misma manera mas ganancias económicas provenientes del destazo y del cafetin.

Las metas que el señor Visitación tiene para un futuro, son las de tener una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad  y un comedor.
texts.en:
Visitación is a 57-year-old man.  He has been a small farmer for over 27 years.  He started to work in farming with his father and with time he learned his mother's work, butchering, and since then he has working in that business and in farming.  

He has a family, which is made up of his wife, who sells pupusas and hamburgers at a small café on the side of the main road into town, and they also have a daughter and a son who are currently living in the United States.  

Visitación butchers pigs on Mondays and the rest of the week he farms.  He has 15 years of experience butchering pigs and he decided to continue with this business because of his profits, which allow him to provide more financial support to his household.  
    
The offered loan will be invested in his butchering business and in the small café his wife runs.  They will be able to keep the café better stocked and they will also earn more from the butchering and the café.

Visitación's future goals are to have a meat market and a canteen in the city centre.

loans.use: to invest in his butchering business and to buy more products to sell at his small café

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking pans and a commercial stove for making tamales.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
Loydith, de 25 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy optimista, está casada y tiene un pequeño hijo a quien le brinda mucha protección y amor, vive en su modesta casa propia construida gracias al fruto de sus ahorros. Loydith tiene como trabajo diario la venta de pescados de la región como bagre, boquichico, palometas, entre otros. Tiene su negocio instalado en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad. Su mercadería la renueva cada día dependiendo de la fluidez de las ventas invirtiendo siempre una buena cantidad de dinero por cada compra que realiza. Atiende sola desde que empezó hace 02 años en este negocio. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades típicas de una ama de casa, afirma que las ganancias económicas que recibe semanalmente son muy lucrativas y eso le brinda la tranquilidad necesaria para enfrentar los gastos básicos de su hogar, desea continuar desarrollando esta actividad implementándolo con mayor cantidad de productos y artículos de primera necesidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará pescados al por mayor.
texts.en:
Loydith, who is 25, is an enterprising and very optimistic woman.  She is married and has a young son she provides with plenty of love and protection.  She lives in her own modest home that was built thanks to the fruit of her savings.  Loydith's daily work is selling fish from the region, such as catfish, chub, and harvest fish, among others.  Her business is set up in one of the city's busiest local markets.  She restocks her merchandise every day depending on her sales and she always invests a good amount of money for every purchase she makes.  She has run this business on her own since she started it two years ago.  

What she likes about her work is that she can use her time to do other typical homemaker chores.  She tells us that her weekly earnings are very lucrative and this offers her the peace of mind she needs to deal with her household expenses.  She wants to keep developing her business by stocking it with a greater amount of products and necessity items.  She is currently asking for 1,000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, as this makes her feel confident in moving forward with her business.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the requested loan to buy fish wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Don francisco de 63 años de edad, labora en un hotel como contador, devenga un salario mínimo y para mantener los gastos de la  canasta básica del hogar alquila cuartos en su vivienda, siendo esto una entrada para equilibrar su economía, solamente el trabaja, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Francisco solicita el crédito para mejorar sus cuartos de alquiler, los cuales tienen unas divisiones de plywood y otra parte de madera, los cuales están deteriorados, desea reforzarlos con material gypsum, plycen, madera y perfil de aluminio para darle una mejor apariencia y confort, para que sus inquilinos se sientan bien.
texts.en: Sixty-three-year-old Francisco works as an accountant at a hotel where he earns minimum wage and he rents rooms in his home to cover his household's basic needs, as this is a way for him to break even.  He is the only one who works; his wife is a homemaker.  Francisco is requesting a loan to improve the rooms he rents, which have plywood and hardwood dividers that are run down.  He wants to reinforce them with gypsum, fiber cement, wood, and aluminum profiles to make them look and feel better so his tenants feel comfortable.

loans.use: to buy gypsum, fiber cement, wood, and aluminum profiles

loans.name: Sha'migul

texts.ru: Шаъмигул замужняя и верная жена. Ей 58 лет. У Шаъмигул есть трое сыновей. Им по 30 лет, 26 и 23 года. Дети Шаъмигуля уже взрослые самостоятельные. Старший сын работает на стройке строителем, у двоих младших сыновей маленький бизнес, а муж Шаъмигуля занимается земледелием. Сама Шаъмигул около 15 лет занимается торговлей. Она продает таджикские веники и соль. Шаъмигул веселая жизнерадостная женщина. Она всегда с улыбкой смотрит на проблемы и смело идет к своей мечте. Сейчас она планирует расширить свой бизнес и увеличит товарооборот. Из-за того что у нее нет достаточной суммы денег она не может купить веники и соль для продажи, поэтому она просит кредит.
texts.en: Sha'migul is a trustworthy, married woman. She is 58 years old. Sha'migul has three sons. They are 30, 26 and 23 years old. Sha'migul's children are already grown-up and self-sufficient. Her eldest son works on a construction site, her two younger sons have small businesses and her husband practices crop farming. Sha'migul has been in the retail business for around 15 years. She sells Tajik brooms and salt. Sha'migul is a happy, vivacious woman. She always looks at problems with a smile and pursues her dreams with confidence. Now, she is planning to expand her business and increase her sales turnover. As she does not have enough money, she is unable to buy brooms and salt for retail sale, which is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy brooms and salt.

loans.name: Victor Pedro

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Victor no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Victor se dedica a sembrar plantas medicinales, las cuales luego vende en los mercados de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado y las paredes de su hogar, así pues Victor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada para su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is a 55-year-old man.  He lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with his wife and three children.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic and he puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial means and a need for him to work at a very young age, Victor was not able to pursue a degree.

On his own initiative, Victor works growing medicinal plants that he then sells in his city's markets.  He works every day for around 10 hours and he believes it is going well because of his hard work and dedication.  

Victor is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help he has been offered that he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to reinforce the roof and walls of his home.  Victor will keep working and applying himself to achieve his greatest dream of having a safe, suitable home for his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Maira Lizeth

texts.es:
Maira tiene 36 años de edad, tiene un grado de estudio primaria completa esto porque no le gusto estudiar, con el tiempo ella se casó y con su pareja procrearon tres hijos. El esposo y ella se dedican al cultivo de café haciendo compañía el hijo mayor el cual tiene 12 años y acaba de terminar el sexto grado, la segunda tiene 6 años y acaba de terminar la preparatoria yendo el próximo año a primaria y el tercero tiene 3 años y hasta el próximo año ira a pre-kínder. Desde niña trabaja la tierra en el cultivo de café esto porque sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y los conocimientos necesarios que hoy en día sigue practicando junto a su esposo. La tierra que ellos trabajan en familia es herencia que le dejaron los padres de su esposo. Ella tiene 3 ½  manzanas en total, 3 productoras y ½  en plantía. Además para la temporada de café Maira se dedica a la venta de ropa ya que para esta temporada de fin de año el movimiento en la zona donde ella habita es bueno para el comercio obteniendo mayores ingresos ya que ella piensa que no solo pueden subsistir del café y existe la probabilidad de que el precio baje en el mercado, o que el intermediario no le pague el café a un precio justo.
Maira solicita financiamiento para la compra de abono, foliares, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para sacar el café y hacer todo el procedimiento, ya que la propiedad cultivada es grande y quiere evitar el descuido de las mismas al momento de la recolección o del cuidado.
Maira tiene como meta mejorar la producción de café para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así comprar más propiedades para dejar en herencia a sus hijos, teniendo el día de mañana donde trabajar y donde poder construir sus hogares.
texts.en:
Maira is 36 years old, she has completed primary school but she didn't like to study. Now she is married and they have three children together. She and her husband cultivate coffee together with their oldest child who is 12 years old and has recently finished sixth grade. Their second child is six years old and has just finished her preparatory year, moving on to primary school next year. Their third child is three years old and goes to kindergarden. 

Maira has cultivated coffee since she was a child, because her parents taught her this activity and the required knowledge, which she continues putting into practice together with her husband. They inherited the land they are working from her husband's parents. They own 3 ½ plots of land, three are producing and the last half is being planted. 

In addition to cultivating coffee, Maira sells clothes because during the end of the year the area where she lives is very busy and thus suited for commerce. She takes this opportunity to increase her income, thinking that they can't rely solely on coffee because there is a risk that the market price goes down or that the intermediaries don't pay her a fair price.

Maira is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, liquid plant food and fertilizers. She will also use it to pay for labor to care for the coffee and harvest it, because her cultivated area is large and she doesn't want it to be neglected during growth or harvest. Maira's goal is to increase her production of coffee in order to improve her income so that she can buy more land. She wants to leave it as an inheritance to her children, making sure they have a place to work and build their homes in the future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee cultivations

loans.name: Mirzorabi

texts.ru: Мирзораби имеет высшее медицинское образование. Ему 53 года. Он женат и живет с женой и сыном в городе Исфара. Мирзораби по профессии врач уролог и работает в государственной центральной больнице города Исфары в течение 20 лет. Одновременно он собирается там открыть свой частный бизнес. У него имеется личный кабинет, где он хочет оснастить его медицинскими приборами и предоставлять свои частные медицинские услуги. В данный момент он готовится к открытию своего кабинета. Мирзораби просит в кредит 3000 долларов США. Он хочет приобрести два медицинских аппарата. Это аппарат по измерению кровяного давления и аппарат по измерению сахара. Благодаря кредиту у него появится дополнительный источник дохода и он сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Mirzorabi has a higher education in the field of medicine. He is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and son in the city of Isfara. Mirzorabi is a urologist and has worked in in the central state hospital in the city of Isfara for 20 years. Simultaneously, he is planning to open his own private business there. He has a private office which he wants to equip with medical devices and then offer his own medical services commercially. He is currently getting ready to open his office. Mirzorabi is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD. He wants to buy two medical devices. One device is for measuring blood pressure and the other is for measuring sugar levels. Thanks to the loan, he will have an additional source of income and he will be able to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: To buy a device to measure blood pressure and a device to measure sugar levels.

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru: Ее зовут Зебонисо. Ей 30 лет. Она живет на районе Восеъ. Там же она продолжает свою деятельность. Зебонисо замужем. У нее есть четверо сыновей. Два старших сына ходят в школу им по 10 и 8 лет. Младшим сыновьям еще рано в школу им по 5 и 3 годика. Муж Зебонисо уехал заграницу на заработки. Сама Зебонисо занимается продажей одежды и обуви. К приходу зимы жители района Восеъ спешат приобрести теплую одежду и теплую обувь. Пользуясь моментом, Зебонисо решила привести теплую одежду, зимнюю обувь и галоши для продажи. Но для закупки необходимого количество товара у Зебонисо не хватает средств, поэтому она просит кредит. Зебонисо ожидает, что она получит Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Her name is Zeboniso. She is 30 years old. She lives in the Vose District. She continues to work at her business there. Zeboniso is married. She has four sons. Her two older sons attend school. They are 10 and 8 years old. Her younger sons are too young for school. They are 5 and 3 years old. Zeboniso's husband left to work abroad. Zeboniso is in the business of selling clothing and shoes. With the upcoming arrival of winter, Vose residents are hurrying to buy warm clothes and shoes. Seizing this opportunity, Zeboniso decided to buy warm clothes, winter shoes and galoshes for retail sale. Zeboniso does not have enough money for this necessary purchase of merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan. Zeboniso hopes that she will receive your help.

loans.use: To buy galoshes, winter shoes and warm clothes.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат начинающий бизнесмен в сфере животноводства. Ему 33 года. Он из села района Кубадиён. Шухрат хочет начать свой бизнес, но начального капитала ему не хватает, ведь деятельность животноводства требует много сил и средств. Большинство породистых коров и быков в Таджикистане, сумма которых начинаются от $1000. Конечно, для бизнеса животноводства сумму, которую он просит, является маленькой. Шухрат не стал рисковать и решил начать с малого. Он намерен на сумму от кредита купить пару голов бычков. После определенного дня откорма, продаст их на рынке с наценкой и заработает денег. Таким не хитрым способом, он хочет в будущем развить свой бизнес. Но для начала этот бизнес надо обосновать, поэтому он просить кредит с надеждой, что Вы ему поможете!
texts.en: Shurat is new to the livestock-raising business.  He is a 33-year-old resident of a village in the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  He would like to start his own business, but lacks the capital to do so; being a successful livestock farmer takes not only a lot of time, but money as well.  For instance, any cattle of good stock cost upwards of $1000 USD.  All the same, Shurat is not seeking to borrow a whole lot of money.  He doesn't like to take risks, and would much rather start small than risk everything at the outset.  He plans on taking out a loan to buy only a couple of cows for starters.  After he determines when they've been fattened enough and are ready to sell, he'll sell the cows at a local market for more than he paid for and make a tidy profit.  He hopes to earn an honest wage by dealing in cattle, and grow his business over time.  First and foremost, he needs to get his business up and running, and hopes you'll help him by contributing to his loan!

loans.use: set up a new livestock-raising business and buy some bull calves.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza, de 50 años, es una mujer valiente y trabajadora, está casada con Max y con él tiene 6 hijos, 2 de los cuales aun viven junto a ella y su esposo en su casa propia. El trabajo de Maritza consiste en la venta de juguetes como muñecas, carritos, etc. También vende bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas, tiene 2 refrigeradoras en su casa en donde congela a diario todas las bebidas que luego pone a la venta a sus ocasionales clientes. Afortunadamente le va muy bien y sus ventas mejoran con el paso del tiempo. Además vende hielos. Lleva en este negocio más de 08 años y lo hace con ayuda de sus hijos mientras su esposo desarrolla otras actividades. Además de vender gaseosas, también vende hielos y chupetes que son del agrado de sus clientes y que también le generan un ingreso económico adicional para su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, es una socia muy responsable y solidaria dentro de su grupo, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir desarrollando su negocio además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará juguetes para esta campaña navideña y así poder cumplir con los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Maritza is a brave and hard-working woman.  She is married to Max, with whom she has six children.  The couple has their own house, where two of their children still live.  Maritza makes a living selling toys, such as dolls, toy cars, etc.  She also sells beverages, such as a fizzy drinks and beers.  She has two fridges in her house where, every day, she chills the drinks before putting them on sale to her customers.  Maritza also sells ice.

Fortunately, the business is going very well for Maritza and sales are improving as time goes on.  Maritza has had the business for over eight years, and she runs it with the help of her children while her husband does other work.  As well as selling fizzy drinks, Maritza also sells ice and lollipops, which her customers like, and which generates an extra income for the household.  On this occasion Maritza is applying for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles.  Maritza is a very responsible and caring member of her group.  She is grateful to those who are providing this loan that she needs to continue developing her business plan.  Maritza promises to make her repayments on time.

Maritza will use this loan to buy toys for the Christmas season so that she can fulfil her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy toys in bulk.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua viviendo en el Cusco y con el pequeño negocio de venta de productos de material plástico.  Ella sigue participando en el Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo bolsas, platos, vasos y cubiertos desechables.   
Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Angelica is grateful to all lenders for her previous loan and she is happy with the help provided.  Angelica continues to live in Cusco, where she has a small business selling plastic goods.  Angelica remains a part of the "Virgen de Chapi" communal bank and, on this occasion, needs a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as bags, cups, and disposable cutlery.

Cusco is known as an area high in tourism and commercial activities because of the "Inti Raymi" traditional festival, and because it is so close to Machu Picchu, on the of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as plastic bags.

loans.name: La Carrera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Carrera” está integrado por seis mujeres y un hombre; todos viven en una misma comunidad, todos se conocen desde hace ya varios años. En dicha comunidad, las personas aún conservan su lengua materna: el mazahua. La mayoría de las mujeres aún visten sus trajes típicos muy coloridos, la fiesta más celebrada de la comunidad es el día 14 de septiembre celebran “El señor de los milagros”. 
Doña Alejandra es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene 45 años de edad está casada con el señor José Luis desde hace 25 años juntos han formado una familia con 9 hijos de los cuales tres dependen de dicha pareja. Mientras Don José Luis trabaja en el campo Doña Alejandra se dedica a la cría y engorda de pollos guajolotes y borregos para después venderlos entre sus vecinos de la misma comunidad, amigas y familiares con su actividad económica lleva ya tres años platica que la inicio porque cuando le ofrecieron su primer crédito en VisionFund pensó que era una muy buena actividad para ayudar con los gastos del  hogar y con la educación de sus hijos Doña Alejandra lleva ya varios ciclos con su crédito y gracias a ellos ha podido tener sus animalitos. “Gracias a los créditos de VisionFund y KIVA los beneficios para mi familia han sido muchos porque ahora podemos mantener los estudios de mis hijos sin ningún problema”. Cuenta que su única dificultad es cuando sus animales llegan a enfermarse y pueden llegar hasta morir esto a Doña Alejandra le entristece mucho porque son perdidas de inversión y ganancias. Platica que es muy fácil y cómodo criar sus animalitos así puede estar al pendiente de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo criar sus animales, el único sueño de Doña Alejandra es poder seguir criando sus animales para seguir solventando los gastos de sus hijos sin ninguna dificultad, las integrantes del grupo son Victoria quien invierte en frutas y verduras, Julia en borregos, María del Carmen y Leticia invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes, Don Alberto  invertirá en renta de cimbra, Doña Bonifacia invertirá en la cría de sus guajolotes. Ellos están muy agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado porque para ellos será de gran ayuda para hacer crecer sus actividades productivas.
texts.en:
The group “La Carrera” consists of six women and one man. They all live in the same community and have known each other for several years. In this community, people still preserve their mother tongue, Mazahua. Most women still wear their very colorful traditional garments. The most celebrated holiday in this community is September 14, "The Lord of the Miracles" day. 

Alejandra is a hard-working woman aged 45. She is married to José since 25 years back, and they have formed a family with nine children whereof three are still dependent on their parents. José works in the field and Alejandra breeds and fattens chickens, turkeys, and sheep and then sells them to neighbors, friends, and relatives. 

She has been running this business for three years and she says she started it when she was offered her first VisionFund loan, thinking that this activity could help her pay for the household expenses and for her children's education. Alejandra has already completed several loan cycles and thanks to that she has been able to buy her little animals. 

"Thanks to the VisionFund loans and to Kiva, my family has received many benefits because now we can pay for my children's studies without any difficulties." She comments that the only hardship is when her animals get sick, or even die. This makes Alejandra very sad because it entails losses in investments and income. She says that it is very easy and comfortable to raise animals because she can keep an eye on her children while she is taking care of her animals. Alejandra's dream is to be able to continue raising her animals, thus continuing paying for the costs of her children without difficulties.

The other group members are Victoria, who sells fruits and vegetables; Julia, who raises sheep; María del Carmen and Leticia who run grocery stores; Alberto, who will rent centerings for construction; and Bonifacia, who raises turkeys. They are all grateful to VisionFund and to Kiva for the loan they have been offered, because it will help them to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens, turkeys, and sheep

loans.name: Akiba Group

texts.fr:
Saleh fait partie du groupe  Akiba et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 51 et est mariée à Mohamed un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 14 a 23 ans, dont 1 étudie.
Elle a sous sa charge sa belle sœur.

Elle fait le commerce des habits, elle est aussi tailleur depuis  6 ans. 

Elle est à  son  sixième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de pagnes et une grande quantité de matériels de couture(du fil,des aiguilles ,vaseline,...)à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Saleh is a member of the Akiba group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 51 years old and is married to Mohamed, a driver. Together they have three children, aged from 14 to 23 years old. One of the children goes to school. She also takes care of her sister-in-law.

Saleh sells clothing, and she has been a seamstress for six years.

This is her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy many pagnes [lengths of colorful fabric] and a large quantity of sewing materials (thread, needles, vaseline, etc.) to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [colorful fabric] and a large quantity of sewing materials (thread, needles, vaseline, etc) to resell

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés, de 48 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Inés, consiste principalmente en la venta de comida. Tiene su puesto de ventas ubicado en concurrido mercado de la ciudad y ahí ofrece diariamente los más deliciosos platos regionales. Su labor empieza desde muy temprano y culmina aproximadamente a las 3 de la tarde. Lleva realizando este negocio por 8 años con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo. Paralelamente tiene un puesto contiguo de pasamanería en el cual atiende principalmente su pareja y ella solo apoya cuando no tiene clientes en su puesto de comida. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que desarrolla una labor que le fascina desde muy pequeña, siempre cocinó y le agrada ahora ponerlo en práctica como una oportunidad de negocio, además gracias a este trabajo tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le sirven para solventar los gastos de su hogar y brindarles las comodidades necesarias a su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas. Con el monto solicitado comprará progresivamente todos los ingredientes e insumos utilizados en la preparación de sus comidas como aceites, arroz, verduras, tubérculos, condimentos carnes y otros productos.
texts.en:
Inés, 48, is married with a 12-year-old son.  They all live together in their own home.  Inés works mostly selling food.  She has a stall in a busy market in the city and there she offers the most delicious regional dishes.  She starts work very early, and she finishes at about 3 o’clock in the afternoon.  She has been doing this for eight years with the unconditional support of her husband.  
At the same time, she also has an adjacent stall which sells various types of accessories, which her husband usually looks after.  Inés will usually help out when she hasn’t got any customers at her food stall.  

What she enjoys most about her work is that she is doing a job that has always fascinated her since she was little.  She has always cooked and she likes being able to use it now as a career.  Not only that, but she is also quite successful and generates enough income to pay the household expenses and provide for her family.

She is asking for a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles.  She is very happy to know that she has financial backing to be able to work towards achieving her goals.  With the amount she is asking for she will progressively buy all the ingredients and supplies that she uses to prepare her meals such as oil, rice, vegetables, yuccas and yams, meat and other products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as oil, rice and vegetables among others.

loans.name: Mireli

texts.es: Mireli, de 46 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, convive con Homero con quien tiene 6 hijos sin embargo vive solo con una de ellas quien tiene 14 años de edad, los tres viven en su casa propia. El trabajo de Mireli comienza muy temprano con la apertura de su puesto de pollos. Tiene un establecimiento que ha construido en su casa y ahí ofrece sus pollos beneficiados los cuales vende por kilo, o enteros. Vive en una zona muy concurrida lo cual le permite tener buenas ventas durante el día. También tiene otro puesto de ventas de pollos en uno de los principales mercados de la ciudad que lo compró a la asociación de vendedores tras muchos años de ahorro constante, ahí realiza el mismo trabajo tratando muy bien a sus clientes. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 4 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta ligado a las ventas y siempre se consideró una buena comerciante, además gracias a la cantidad de clientes que ha conseguido en estos años obtiene muchas ventas y por lo tanto tiene muy buenas ganancias económicas, espera poder agrandar su espacio de atención y ofrecer a la venta mas productos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará pollos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mireli is a dynamic and hard-working woman aged 46. She lives with Homero, with whom she has six children. However, they are only living with one of them, a 14-year-old daughter, in the house they own. Mireli's work starts very early in the morning when she opens her chicken stall. She has prepared a part of her house where she offers her plucked and gutted chickens, selling them whole or by weight. She lives in a very busy area which allows her to sell a lot during the day. 

She also has another chicken stall located in one of the main markets of the city, which she has bought from the vendor's association after many years of persistent saving. There she works in the same way, treating her clients very well. She has been running this business for four years with the help of her husband. What she likes about her job is that it has to do with sales, and she always considered herself a good merchant. Besides, thanks to the great number of clients that she has obtained over the years, she has very good sales and thus a very good income. She hopes to expand her business space and offer more products. 

On this occasion she is requesting 1,000 PEN. She is very touched by the fact that there are people who offer her economic support so that she can continue developing her business. She pledges to make her repayments on time and responsibly pay back her loan. She will use the requested loan to buy wholesale chickens.

loans.use: to buy wholesale chickens

loans.name: Jason

texts.es: Jason es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de café, en esta época en nuestro país la cosecha de este producto ya inició y Jason necesita trasladar el grano recolectado hasta el lugar donde se lo compran, él no cuenta con un vehículo apropiado para transportarlo y por ello solicita un crédito por seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para completar el costo del vehículo y poder comprarlo lo antes posible ya que le es de suma importancia adquirirlo.
texts.en: Jason is a farmer who grows coffee.  The harvest season in our country has started and Jason needs to transport his crop to where he can sell it.  He hasn't got a suitable vehicle at the moment and that is why he is asking for a loan of 600,000 colons to make up the money he needs to buy one.  It is important for him to have it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for his business (to transport coffee).

loans.name: Celvin Orlando

texts.es: Celvin, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero y ayudaba a su padre en la agricultura. El lleva 10 años de dedicarse a su propio cultivo de arroz. El cultivo lo tiene en los campos agrícolas, zona apta para el arroz. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, funguicidas y otros insumos para su cultivo de arroz y poder sacar buena producción. Su plan es tener trabajo, obtener ingresos para la manutención y salud familiar y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en: Celvin is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Negrito municipality in Yoro.  Previously Celvin worked as a labourer and helped his father with his farming work.  Now Celvin has ten years experience growing his own rice in the fields, in an area which is perfect for growing rice.  Celvin sells his product in the local market.  Celvin is applying for a loan of 10,000 Lempira in order to buy manure, anti-fungal treatments, and other supplies for his rice crops so as to have a good harvest.  Celvin's plans are to keep working, to earn a living to support his family's food and health needs, and to make sure his children stay in school.

loans.use: to buy manure, anti-fungal treatments, and other supplies for his rice crops.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina es una mujer de 52 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Angelina no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Angelina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de bebidas, adicionalmente vende ropa por temporadas y algunos productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Angelina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado y las paredes de madera de su hogar, así pues Angelina seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Angelina is 52 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic, and uses all her strength to move forward. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and to the need to work from an early age, Angelina wasn't able to study. 

Angelina works on her own initiative selling beverages. In addition to that she sells clothes by season and also some beauty products. She works every day for around 10 hours and she believes that it is going well because of the dedication and effort she puts into it. 

Angelina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the help they offer she will make improvements to her home. She wishes to reinforce the wooden roof and walls of her home. Angelina will continue working and struggling to achieve her great dream of living in a safe and comfortable house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Catarino

texts.es:
Catarino  es un hombre soltero de 66 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja y sus seis hijos de los cuales tres ya están casados y  los otros tres ayudan a su padre en el trabajo de campo.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla y papa  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre desde que era pequeño es por ello que decidió seguir con esta labor que ha sido bastante productiva y rentable en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
Ahora cuenta con 45 años de experiencia en esta actividad y es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,500.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas que servirá para su cultivo y de esta manera mejorara la economía de su familia.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, para que en un futuro sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Catarino, 66, lives with his wife and six children.  Three of his children are now married and the other three help their father work on the farm.
He works in agriculture growing onions and potatoes in plots of land that he has a few metres from his home.  He learnt this profession from his father when he was little and so he decided to continue in this line of work.  He has been quite productive and successful in generating income and profit.

With 45 years’ experience, he is now asking for a loan of 7,500 quetzales to buy agricultural supplies that will help his crop and improve the financial situation of his family.

His dream is to generate more profit to improve his family’s standard of living so that in the future his children have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
Nemecia agradece a todos los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua viviendo en la ciudad del Cusco y con la pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde sigue vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nemecia thanks all the lenders for the loan and the support she has been offered. She continues living in the city of Cusco and running her little grocery store in her home. She sells basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, preserves, and other products. 

This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, pasta, and more. 

Cusco is know for being a very touristic and commercial area, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the new seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu is located in the region.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flour, sugar, pasta, and more

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is 37 years old; he is a coffee farmer, and also runs a bar to supplement his income. He began the business to earn income to look after his family. His clients are people in the urban centres. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer. 

He hopes to have a large coffee plantation in the future. His challenge is climatic changes, which hinder his output at times. However, he is hardworking. 

In the photo is the client and the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the highland area of Kericho, a very rich area for tea production. He is a farmer, married, and has three children. He produces tea and milk. 

Farming is his main source of income.  Like many farmers in Kericho, Moses really enjoys dairy farming as it always gives him a good return. His biggest challenge in dairy farming is getting dairy feed.

He chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have good repayment terms at a low interest rate; he will construct a dairy unit for his cows.

This loan will help him educate his children better ,and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region of Armenia. He has been an educator for many years and is now working as a geography teacher. Samvel is married and he has two children. His son is already grown up and is a director of the school in Tashir city, while his daughter is married, lives with her family and is also a teacher. 
Samvel also teaches individual students at his home, preparing them for their entrance examinations. He is a much respected teacher and a beloved father and husband to his family. He says that he always does things thoroughly and with great dedication, and so he wants provide interesting and useful lessons both at school and for his private students.
Samvel is asking for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and interesting and necessary literature for his teaching.

loans.use: to buy a computer and literature for his teaching

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, daughter, and school-age son. 

Hasmik works at the village local school as a deputy director; her daughter also works at the same school. Their salaries unfortunately are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries. To be able to meet the increasing needs of her family, Hasmik, with the help of her husband, is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets, aviculture, and in the cultivation of cucumbers, tomatoes, watermelon, and alfalfa. They sell the agricultural products in the local market; this is an important source of income for them. 

To sustain her agribusiness, Hasmik needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to renovate the barn, as it is in poor condition, and to purchase some forage for the livestock. 

Hasmik and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, as it is in poor condition, and to purchase some forage for the livestock

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine, an experienced farmer, lives with her son in Mrgashat village in the Armavir region of Armenia. Together with her son, she is engaged in breeding cattle and sheep. 

Narine's son is a shepherd. During the summer they move to Lusakn village in the Aragatsotsn region, and in winter they return to their village. They work hard and sell their agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for the family. 

As the winter approaches, Narine needs to prepare her agribusiness for the cold season. She is requesting a loan of $2,000 (US) to purchase forage for her cattle and sheep. Because this is Narine’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit before because they have no credit history. 

Narine and her son rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be very thankful to them for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her cattle and sheep

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is a farmer from Arazap village of Armavir region. He lives with his wife, mother, and elderly pensioner grandmother. 

Arman is a construction worker and is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is not enough to fully meet the family's daily needs. He is also engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding a livestock of piglets, and in the cultivation of onions, greens, and watermelon. 

Arman sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of income for the family. Arman has one greenhouse and currently wants to build another one to sustain his agribusiness. 

He needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase the necessary materials for greenhouse construction (pipes, cellophane, cables), to buy tomato seeds, and to purchase fertilizer. 

Arman and his family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary materials for greenhouse construction (pipes, cellophane, cables), to buy tomato seeds, and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, 32, has two children. She trades in eggs and poultry feed. She began this business to increase her income and venture into a different business. She hopes to finish her house. 

Juliet's challenges are poor feeds and a lack of transportation to reach farmers. She is an innovative lady who studies her clients and her market. She believes, with this loan from UGAFODE, her business will get better soon.

In the photo is Juliet and the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin tiene 26 años, su pareja se fue a trabajar a España hace unos meses y tiene un hijo pequeño que depende de él, se dedica a la elaboración de quesillos y ya que en esta época del año el alimento escasea requiere un crédito para poder comprar cascara de soya para su ganado porque si no está bien alimentado producirá menos, él quiere mantener el nivel de producción para seguir trabajando y así cubrir las necesidades de su familia y proporcionarles un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Edwin is 26 years old.  His partner went to work in Spain a few months ago and he has a small son who is dependent on him.  He is engaged in the preparation of “quesillos” [tortillas with cream cheese filling].  Since feed is scarce this time of year, he needs a loan to purchase soybean husks for his livestock because they will produce less if they are not well fed.  He wishes to maintain the level of production to continue working and, in this way, pay for his family’s needs and provide them with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase soybean husks for his livestock.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en: Sargis is an experienced agronomist from Taperakan village of Ararat region. He lives with his wife and three school-age children (two daughters and one son). It has been more than 15 years since Sargis became extensively engaged in agriculture. With the help of his wife, he is involved in aviculture, viniculture and cultivation of wheat, apricot, pomegranate, and apple. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. As the winter is very close, Sargis needs to prepare his agribusiness for winter in order for it to be productive. To reach that goal he needs a loan of USD 3000 to prepare the vineyard for winter, purchase wheat seeds, and buy pipes and cables for viniculture. Sargis and his family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will be very grateful to them for the support in collecting the needed loan amount.
