loans.use: to prepare his vineyard for winter, purchase wheat seeds, and buy pipes and cables for viniculture

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a farmer, lives with his parents in Qarakert village in the Armavir region of Armenia. To take care of his family's needs, Robert is engaged in breeding cattle, in cultivating alfalfa and in aviculture as well as viniculture. He sells his agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

Robert’s parents assist him greatly in his daily farming activities. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Robert needs to make some investments. He particularly needs a loan of $3,000 US to purchase forage (alfalfa and combined forage), two steers and trestles for his viniculture activities. With the help of this loan, Robert will develop his agribusiness further. 

He and his family highly rely on the goodwill of lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage (alfalfa and combined forage), two steers and trestles for viniculture

loans.name: Yashin

texts.en:
Yashin is a 28-year-old farmer. He began this business to be able to earn a living. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers. 

Yashin hopes to be able to provide for his family adequately and also pay for his children's tuition on time. His challenge is climatic changes, but he is hardworking. In the photo is the client and the Ugafode credit officer (right to left).

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está casada y tiene un hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Karina es la venta de comidas y refrescos que prepara ella misma. Tiene ubicado su puesto de venta en un mercado cercano a su vivienda. Su actividad empieza todos los días por las mañanas y culmina al iniciarse la tarde. En ocasiones sus ventas son muy buenas ya que logra vender todo lo que ofrece durante el día. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 12 años brindando siempre una buena atención. Ocasionalmente vende pescados y pollos. Se inició comprando pequeñas cantidades de materia prima, poco a poco fue incrementando su capital y gracias ello pudo elaborar una mayor cantidad de productos. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que percibe constantemente. Por otro lado comenta que decidió iniciar esta labor pensando en el bienestar de su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.  Ahora espera establecer otro puesto de venta e incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con el logro de sus metas. Se compromete a ser un cliente puntual y muy responsable como son los demás integrantes de su grupo. Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, harina, pollo, fríjol, yuca y maíz para que prepare los productos que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Karina is 34 years old, she is a hard-working and diligent person. She is married and has one child with whom she lives in the house she owns. Her business is selling food and soft drinks that she prepares herself. Her stall is located in a market close to her home. She works every day from morning to evening. Sometimes her sales are very good when she is able to sell all her products during the day. She works together with her sister. 

She has been running this business for 12  years, always with a lot of care. Occasionally she sells fish and chickens, too. She started out buying small quantities of inputs, and her capital increased little by little until she was able to buy larger quantities of products. She considers this business profitable because it consistently brings her good incomes. She comments that she decided to start this business with her family's well-being in mind and in order to help her husband cover for the household expenses. Now she is hoping to establish another stall and increase her income. 

This time she is requesting 1,000 PEN and she is grateful for the opportunity offered, which allows her to continue working to achieve her goals. She pledges to be a punctual and responsible borrower just like the rest of her group. She will use the loan to buy rice, flour, chicken, beans, cassava, and corn in order to prepare food and sell it.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, chicken, beans, and more

loans.name: Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her late 40s, is a widow with four children, two of them grown and the other two still at school.  

She has been running a fruits and vegetables business for three years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more fruits and vegetables to sell to more people. She dreams of building her own house.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "UFUNUO," which has five members who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more  fruits and vegetables and sell to more people.

loans.name: Kyempara Women In Development Group

texts.en:
Faith is 52 years old and married, with four children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda.

She has been in the retail business for three years, plus having a government salary as additional income. Faith started her business to look after her family and also not to depend on the government salary that in most cases comes late.

She hopes to expand her business into a mini-super market and take it to a more busy place in Kasese town. Like other retail traders, she is challenged by the increasing inflation and price fluctuations. She is a member of the Kyempara Women in Development Group, where each member guarantees the other to acquire a loan.

Faith is in need of a loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Gastronomía.
Por iniciativa propia, Juan trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará la construcción de una habitación en su hogar, de esta manera el y sus hermanos tendrán un lugar adecuada y seguro donde descansar, así pues Juan seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran Chef.
texts.en: Juan is a 21 year old man.  He is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He is very hardworking, enthusiastic, and dedicates all of his efforts to getting ahead.  Thanks to his efforts and his parents’ support, he was able to study for a technical degree in gastronomy. By his own initiative, Juan works as a field laborer at a farm in the city. He works every day for about ten hours and believes that it is going well because of his dedication and hard work. Juan is very thankful for the Kiva loans because, thanks to the help they offer, he will build a room in his home.  In this way, he and his siblings will have an adequate, safe place to rest.  Thus, he will continue working and striving to achieve his big dream of becoming a great chef.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Ericka Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Ericka es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ericka se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Contabilidad.
Por iniciativa propia, Ericka trabaja como secretaria en un centro odontológico de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Ericka se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizará el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea tarrajear y ponerle piso a su hogar, así pues Ericka seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una contadora exitosa.
texts.en:
Ericka is a 23 year old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She is very hardworking and enthusiastic who puts all of her effort into getting ahead. Thanks to her hard work and her parents' support, Ericka is studying accounting. 

On her own initiative, Ericka works as a secretary in a dental center in her city. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and she thinks that it is going well for her because of her dedication and good performance.  

Ericka is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will do some home improvement. She wants to cover the walls and put in a floor in her house. Ericka will keep working and striving to make her dream come true of becoming a successful accountant.

loans.use: to do home improvement.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is a farmer from Mayisyan village in the Armavir region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, his five-year-old daughter and his parents. 

Vardan and his parents are employed in the private sector. All members of the family work hard, struggling to make a living. Their salaries, however, are not enough to fully meet the family's needs. 

To effectively cover their needs, and with the help of his family, Vardan is engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture and in cultivating barley, tomatoes, greens, grass and fruit (apricots, plums and apples). He sells his agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of his family's income. 

Because life gets more expensive day by day, Vardan wants to expand his agribusiness to make ends meet. A loan of $1,500 US will support him greatly by enabling him to purchase two steers, four pigs and forage for the livestock. 

Vardan and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase two steers, four pigs and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is a single mother who lives in Katovu village, in the suburbs of Lyantonde town. She is 52 years old and has five children between the ages of 22 and 28. Only one of them still goes to school. Fausta has been with the institution for some time and has got two loans previously. She would like to get money to buy more charcoal for her store. Her desire is to make enough money to be able to meet all her needs.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Alexis El Rodeo Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelica María es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 37 años de edad. De escolaridad secundaria completa. Tiene 2 hijos  y de ellos 1 esta estudiando. Se dedica al comercio de Ropa para Bebes. Inició este negocio con el apoyo de sus padres y a la fecha tiene 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que invertirá para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando más mercadería y surtir la venta para estas épocas navideñas y de fin de año. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital propio y desea que su negocio crezca. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y venta de productos por catálogos.

Una de las integrantes del grupo no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Angelica María is 37 years old, married, and has completed secondary education. She has two children, one of whom goes to school. Her business is selling baby clothing. She initiated this business with the help of her parents, and to date she has eight years of experience. 

She organizes a group and is requesting a loan that she will use to increase her working capital by buying more products and stock her business for the Christmas season. She hopes that in the future she will have her own capital and she wishes for her business to grow. The rest of the group members are merchants and sell products by catalogue.

One of the group members wasn't able to joint them when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos se dedica a la cría de ganado y necesita agilizar sus labores diarias para ser más productivo, por está razón está solicihtando un crédito por setecientos mil colones (¢700.000) para comprar una máquina cortadora de pasto (alimento para ganado) ya que actualmente lo hace manualmente y le toma mucho tiempo. Juan Carlos manifiesta que obteniendo esta herramienta puede dedicar tiempo a otras actividades y generar mayores ingresos con lo que también mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Juan Carlos raises cattle and needs to speed up his daily activities so he can be more productive. That is why he is asking for a loan of seven hundred thousand colones (¢700,000) to buy a grass cutter (for cattle feed). Right now, he is doing it by hand and it takes a long time. Juan Carlos says that by obtaining this tool he can spend time doing other activities and generate more income that will also improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutter.

loans.name: Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Makonge, who is his early 40s, is married with five children, who are in school. 

For eight years now, he has been running his life by managing a fish business. Makonge works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair return per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his third loan request, which he will use to increase his stock of fish in his business. With the previous loans, all of which he managed to pay back in full, he used to keep his business stock growing and maintain customers' demand, especially at the time of shortage. 

With the profit, Makonge used it to cover his family's food, medical, and shelter expenses. He has paid school fees for his children. He dreams of buying a plot of land and building a nice family house. 

Makonge will share this loan with his loan group" MKOMBOZI," which totals three members, who will hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fish in his business

loans.name: Kavule Kwekamba Group

texts.en:
Chaze, whose hand is raised and who is leaning against the pole, is a 34-year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop, which he started in 2001, and it is located in a very busy trading center. He also offers motorcycle transportation. Chaze plans to expand his business into new markets and educate his children, though his challenge is price fluctuations of most of the essential commodities. He is a member of Kavule Kwekamba Group, in which each member guarantees the others in order to get a loan.

Chaze intends to use the loan to buy more cooking oil, salt, sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, salt, sugar and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: El señor Nestor vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos los cuales dependen de él. Se dedica al sector agrícola y trabaja en su propio terreno que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo. Produce yuca y arroz, que vende a los intermediarios que vienen a comprar al lugar de cosecha, la actividad es familiar pero también contrata personal eventual que le colabora en el mantenimiento y en la cosecha de los productos. Actualmente solicita un crédito para material e insumos para sembrado de arroz, así podrá obtener mejores cosechas y cubrir los gastos de su familia.
texts.en: Nestor lives in the town of Entre Ríos with his wife and their four children who depend on him. He works in agriculture and has his own land that he acquired with a lot of effort. He produces yucca and rice which he sells to intermediaries who come to buy where the harvest is. It is a family activity but he also hires temporary workers to help in the maintenance and the harvest of the crops. Right now, he is asking for a loan for materials to plant rice. This way, he can have better harvests and cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy materials to plant rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old. He deals in poultry and also motorcycle riding as his side source of income. His business is in the rural area. He began the business to support his family. He will use the loan to buy poultry feed in bulk so that he can save on losses due to price fluctuations. His clients are traders. He hopes to expand his business. His challenge is poor feeds in the shops as well as their high costs. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married Ugandan man, 38 years old and living in Kagadi. He has four children, all of whom attend school. He has a boutique business that earns him income to look after his family. He also has rental houses as a source of side income. He hopes to educate his children to attain degrees and build a commercial house, though he is challenged by seasonal customers who affect his profit margin and poor roads that hinder his movement to all the marketplaces where he expects many sales. 

John is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Hannah from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with six children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Hannah runs a palm oil business at home; she sells palm oil and beans. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Hannah says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Hannah has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Remy Gonzalo

texts.es: El  Señor Remy  tiene 34 años casado tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 9 , 3 y un añito,  se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado porcino, el Señor Remy  vive en la zona de los lotes de la Ciudad de Santa cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor Remy  va a usar este préstamo para compra de cerdos para crianza para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos,  el Señor Remy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y así de esta manera poder tener más producción, el Señor Remy  es una persona joven con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica.
texts.en:
Señor Remy lives on a plot of land in the city of Santa Cruz and buys and sells pigs for a living. He is 34, married, and the father of three children, who are ages nine, three, and one. 

Señor Remy is applying for his first loan from the lending institution, and will use the loan funds for the purchase of pigs to raise and to provide his herd with a balanced diet. These steps will boost Señor Remy's income. He faces several challenges as he strives to improve his business and his family's quality of life. He is a young man and aspires to achieve a better life. Señor Remy is happy to have the opportunity that a lender will provide him to improve his business and boost his income, as raising pigs is his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Charist

texts.en:
Charist is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns and operates a retail shop as his main source of income; however, he also practices farming as side income. 

Charist faces challenges of limited capital and bad debtors, but hopes to have a wholesale shop in the future and educate his children to higher levels of education.

Charist is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 20 years old and married, and he lives in Kamwenge, Uganda.

His main business is produce, but he also owns a phone-charging shop in order to earn additional income. 

He has hardships of price fluctuations and seasonal changes that affect dealers in produce, especially when they tend to do hoarding and also they sell raw materials which are bought at a low price.  However, his vision is to educate his children to higher levels and to own a wholesale produce store.

Patrick intends to use the requested loan to buy more coffee, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, beans, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Gor

texts.en:
Gor is a farmer from Hoktember village in the Armavir region of Armenia. He lives with his wife, seven-year-old daughter, one-year-old son and elderly mother, who is a pensioner. 

Gor is engaged in breeding pigs and in cultivating wheat, tomatoes, eggplant and peppers to cover his family's needs. He sells his agricultural products in the local market. He is the family's main breadwinner. His family assists him in his everyday farming activities. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gor needs a loan of $2,000 US to purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds and to pay for harvesting services. 

Gor has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit. Gor took a previous loan from a local financial institution but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. Thanks to hard work during recent times, however, he has been able to run his agribusiness sustainably, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments of this loan. 

Gor and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 33-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 year old and 19 years old. She started the business to meet the daily survival needs of her family.
 
Fatmata runs a cookery business, she sells cooked food in her area and she has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and rice for her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and build a permanent structure. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil and rice for her cookery business.

loans.name: Manzese Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid 30s is married with two children who are still at school. She has been selling rice for two years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Halima's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more rice and is so grateful for the loan. She has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit for school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more rice to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop for rice and to be a food vendor.

Halima will share this loan with her loan group "MANZESE" which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more rice to meet customer demand

loans.name: Yely Albany

texts.es: Yely, a sus 27 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 7 y 9 años. Trabajó como administradora en una papelería por varios años pero, con el interés de mejorar los ingresos decidió renunciar a su empleo y emprender su negocio propio, una miscelánea, para la cual ya posee el local y algunas estanterías y vitrinas, pero requiere comprar surtido al por mayor (accesorios, artículos de papelería, productos de belleza, aseo personal, entre otros) y realizar unas adecuaciones locativas al espacio; razón por la cual solicita el apoyo de su primer ciclo de crédito, con el que podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo y tendrá la capacidad de generar recursos económicos para apoyar  su esposo a solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Yely cuenta con la ventaja de poseer experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, por lo que se anima aún más para trabajar con disciplina y dedicación; esto le ayudará a seguir avanzando y en un futuro poder cumplir el sueño de posicionar el establecimiento y así generar un mejor nivel de ingresos para dar a sus hijos una excelente educación y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yely is 27, married, and the mother of two children, who are seven and nine years old. She worked as a clerk in a stationery shop for several years, but left her job to start her own business, a general store, in order to earn a higher income. 

Yely already has a site and windows, but needs to purchase wholesale inventory (accessories, paper goods, beauty and personal care products, and other items) and make some improvements to her shop. She is therefore applying for her first loan, which will allow her to start the business and generate income to help her husband meet their household expenses. 

Yely has the advantage of experience in managing this type of business, so she's even more motivated to work diligently and with dedication. Operating the store will help her realize her ambition to establish her business and thus boost her income. This additional income will allow Yely to provide her sons a high-quality education and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale inventory (accessories, paper goods, beauty and personal care products, and other items) and make some improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio trabaja en comercio , tiene un abastecedor de cuyos ingresos depende el sostenimiento de su familia, él está solicitando un crédito por por un millón de colones (¢1.000.000)para comprar mercadería y surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época navideña y la demanda de productos es mayor. Luis Antonio manifiesta su agradecimiento por tener  acceso a un financiamiento que para él tiene gran importancia .
texts.en:
Luis Antonio works in commerce.  The income from his grocery store supports his family.

He's requesting a loan for 1,000,000 colones [CRC] to buy merchandise and stock his business.  The Christmas season is approaching and product demand is greater.

Luis Antonio's grateful to have access to a loan that's very important to him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 5 children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Fatmata runs a retail business at home; she sells cigarettes, toothpaste, soap and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Fatmata says that the main challenges to her business are the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more items like rice, soft drinks and biscuits. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, soft drinks and biscuits.

loans.name: Meira Abigail

texts.es:
Meira Abigail es una joven de 21 años de edad, en unión libre, aun no tiene hijos pero está en espera de uno con dos meses de embarazo, un grado de estudio secundaria incompleta cursado hasta el segundo de ciclo común básico ya que cuando estaba estudiando se acompañó con el que hoy en día es su pareja. Su compañero de hogar es el único que se involucra en el trabajo de campo ya que no deja que ella se involucre por el cuido de su embarazo por lo que pasa en su casa de habitación colaborando con los quehaceres domésticos y la preparación de alimentos. Desde niña ella aprendió a trabajar en el campo ya que sus padres le enseñaron como se cultiva el café y adquirió los conocimientos necesarios para poner en práctica y desarrollar la habilidad necesaria. Junto a su compañero de hogar tienen 4 manzanas productoras en total cultivadas las cuales adquirió por esfuerzo propio. Juntos tienen que pagar mozos para la corta ya que es mucho café, y en la aldea busca gente para que trabajen con ella generando trabajo temporal. La tierra está a 20 minutos de su casa de habitación siendo su conyugue quien movilice en vehículo al personal que le colaborara en el campo.
Ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos y pago de mozos ya que de esa forma ella podrá obtener ingresos que ayudaran en el desarrollo de su familia y a re invertir en sus cultivos de café ya que es el patrimonio para su hijo y los futuros.
Meira Abigail tiene como meta mejorar la calidad del café implementando nuevas variedades de producto para obtener mejores ingresos económicos y poder comprar más propiedades, para mejorar su estilo de vida, y así asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Meira Abigail is a 21 year old young woman in a common law marriage.  She doesn’t have any children but is two months pregnant.  She has an incomplete middle school education, since she had already gotten together with her current husband.  He is the only one who works in the fields because he will not let her work because of her pregnancy, so she spends her time cooking and doing the housework.  She learned to work in the fields as a child, and her parents taught her to raise coffee.  She learned what she needed to develop her skills and she and her husband have four plots of farmland they got through their own efforts.  They must pay for field hands to help harvest a great amount of coffee, and they look for seasonal employees in the surrounding area.  The land is located 20 minutes from their home and her husband drives the workers to the field.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies and pay for labor, so she can obtain greater income that will help with the family development and allow her to reinvest into her coffee crops.

Meira Abigail’s goal is to improve the quality of her coffee by planting new varieties to increase her income so she can buy more land.  She will be able to improve her quality of life and secure a future for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Tenneh from the Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children. She started her business to be self-independent. 

Tenneh runs a food stand business at home.  She sells rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings. 

She has been running this business since 2001. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Tenneh says that her business is doing well because it enables her to have her source of income.

Tenneh has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kadie from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is widowed and blessed with 7 children.  She began her small-scale retail business in 2009 to help her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadie requires a loan in order to purchase more items like bananas, pure water, soft drinks and oranges. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. In the future, Kadie plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bananas, pure water, soft drinks and oranges.

loans.name: Ibanda 1 Karugutu Group

texts.en: Emmanuel, whose hand is raised, is a 48-year-old businessman, married, with nine children living in Ntooroko, Uganda. He started business in 1996, selling salt, sugar, rice and paraffin. Apart from the retail shop, he has other sources of income, from cocoa, bananas and vanilla harvests. He dreams of earning more money, so he can to look after his family and educate his children to higher levels of education. He also hopes to expand his business into new markets, even though seasonal changes affect him. He is a member of Ibanda 1 Karugutu group, where each member guarantees the others, to get a loan. Emmanuel is applying for a loan to buy salt, sugar, rice and paraffin to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, rice and paraffin to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.name: Candida Del Carmen

texts.es: Cándida es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 44 años de edad. Casada y madre de cuatros hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado y verduras. Inicio hace varios años, vendiendo poco a poco calzados y verduras; luego con las ganancias que iba adquiriendo iba comprando más productos. Actualmente vende todo tipo de calzado y cuenta con buenas clientelas. Su meta es ofertar nuevos productos para que sus clientes los demanden. Solicita el crédito para comprar: chinelas, sandalias, zapatos, entre otros, con el fin de surtir su negocio. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá su negocio e incrementara sus ventas. Su plan futuro es tener un local para poder vender más productos
texts.en:
Cándida, age 44, is a native of the city of Granada. She is married and the mother of four grown children who live on their won. 

Cándida sells footwear and vegetables for a living. She began this business a few years ago, selling small quantities of footwear and vegetables. She then used the income she was earning to purchase more goods to sell. Cándida now sells all kinds of shoes and has a strong customer base. She would like to offer new products that her customers are asking for, and has applied for a loan to purchase slippers, sandals, shoes, and other footwear to stock her business. She believes that the loan will be very beneficial to her business and boost sales. Her goal for the future is to have a site that will allow her to sell a greater volume of products.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, sandals, shoes, and other footwear.

loans.name: Antonia Elsa

texts.es: La señora Antonia tiene 38 años casada con tres hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad,  en  su tienda de barrio,  que se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Carpenter, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, señora Antonia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como abarrotes, refrescos, dulces y variedad de productos para surtir su tienda,  la señora Antonia va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir surtiendo su tienda con mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, ella es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Antonia, 38, is married and has three children.  She makes a living selling necessity items in her neighborhood store located in the Carpenter area.

This loan is Antonia's first sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy merchandise to stock her store: groceries, soda, sweets, and a variety of products.  With the profits she'll continue stocking her store with merchandise to earn more income.

Antonia's an enterprising person who wants to improve herself.  She's happy for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Exito Group

texts.es:
La señora Anselma Liliana es soltera. Tiene 19 años de edad. De escolaridad primaria completa. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. Inicio este negocio con dos carneros y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar 2 carneros. En el futuro desea tener su propio y amplio capital de trabajo.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos y a tienda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Anselma Liliana is nineteen years old and is single.  She completed primary school.  She makes a living raising domestic animals, and began this business with two lambs.  She has been involved in this work for four years. 

She helped to organize a group and together they are requesting a loan.  Anselma will use her portion to buy two lambs.  In the future, she hopes to have her own sufficient working capital.

The other members of the group make a living raising domestic animals and running a small shop.

loans.use: to buy two lambs.

loans.name: Kadiatu     R

texts.en:
Meet 22-year-old Kadiatu from the Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with one child, age 4 years.  She began her business because she wanted to improve her status of living. 

In 2009, Kadiatu established her general stock business.  She works at the business from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her shop. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 24-year-old Rebecca from the Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is single with 1 child. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Rebecca runs a palm oil business at home; she sells palm oil and pepper. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Rebecca says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and high competition in the market.

Rebecca has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to further her education and increase her business. In the future, she plans to become a medical nurse. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallon of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Meet Zainab, a 45-year-old from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. In 2012, Zainab established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand. Zainab applied for a loan in order to buy charcoal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Zainab plans to open a provisions shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Jestina       S

texts.en: Meet 28-year-old Jestina from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is single and blessed with two children. She began her business because she wants to be self-employed and take care of her parent. In 2012, Jestina established her retail business. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business. Jestina applied for a loan in order to buy more assorted drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Jestina plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 2 children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Fatmata runs a palm oil business at home; she sells palm oil and gari (cassava flakes). She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Fatmata says that the main challenges to her business are transportation price and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Magdalene      S

texts.en: Meet Magdalene, a 25-year-old from the Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and has two children. For the past 11 years, Magdalene has run her cake business. She began her business because she wants to make it grow. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand. Magdalene applied for a loan in order to buy more flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Magdalene plans to open a foodstuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Wendy Lorena

texts.es:
Wendy es una joven de 29 años de edad con un grado de educación cursado hasta el segundo de ciclo común básico ya que estando estudiando conoció a una persona de la cual tuvo un hijo; pero un tiempo después ella se separó de él. Con el tiempo estudio un curso de enfermería pero no la ejerce ya que es muy difícil encontrar trabajo y solo por medio de la política puede colocarse en un centro de salud o una clínica pública. Posterior mente encontró otra persona con la que se acompañó y que actualmente tiene 2 hijos gemelos pero su primer hijo vive con la mama (Abuela). Con esta nueva relación con sus esfuerzos compraron una propiedad donde construyeron un hogar. Su hijo mayor tiene 7 años y está en segundo grado y los segundos (gemelos) tienen 4 años y hasta el próximo año irán a pre-paritaria. Ella se dedica al negocio del cultivo de café desde rubro que aprendió desde niña ya que sus padres le enseñaron como se cultiva el café. Ella tiene 1 manzana y toda está produciendo café, la adquirió con esfuerzo propio ubicada en la parte de atrás de su casa de habitación permitiendo una mayor y personalizada atención a sus cultivos de café. 
Wendy tiene como meta mejorar la producción de café de esa forma mejorara sus ingresos económicos comprara más propiedad cultivada para dejársela en herencia a sus hijos y que puedan cosechar café, mejorar su estilo de vida y que se puedan convertir en excelentes profesionales en el futuro.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, fertilizantes, etc. que puedan ayudar a proteger y fortalecer sus cultivos de café para empezar a realizar sus metas, objetivos y sueños.
texts.en:
Wendy is a young, 29-year-old woman.  She studied through high school and then met someone and had a baby.  A while afterwards, she separated from him.  She studied a nursing career but never actually worked in this profession due to the fact that it is very difficult to find work; a person needs to know someone in order to actually find a position in a health center or public clinic.  

Later, she found a person to spend her life with, and together they have twins (her first son lives with his grandmother).  With this new relationship and through their combined efforts, Wendy and her life partner bought a plot of land and constructed a home.  Her eldest son is seven years old and is in second grade.  The twins are four years old and are in preschool.  

She makes a living growing coffee; she learned how to grow and harvest coffee from her parents when she was a young girl.  She has one plot of land and all of it is dedicated to producing coffee.  She acquired this farmland through her own efforts, and it is located in the area behind her house.  This allows her to give a lot of personalized attention to her coffee crops.

Wendy's goal is to improve her coffee production.  This would permit her to increase her economic income and to buy more land so that she can leave an inheritance to her children, who already know how to harvest coffee.  She hopes that her children will be able to improve their lives and become excellent professionals in the future.  

For these reasons, she is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies, like manure, liquid fertilizers, regular fertilizers, etc.  These items can help protect and strengthen her coffee crops, allowing her to begin reaching her goals, objectives, and dreams.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to attend to her coffee crop.

loans.name: Neneh

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 40-year-old Neneh from the Waterloo Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She started her business to take care of her family. Neneh runs a retail business from home; she sells palm oil, cigarettes, tooth paste, soap and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2011. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Neneh says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient financing to expand her business. Neneh has applied for a loan in order to buy more goods, such as rice, soft drinks and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more goods, such as rice, soft drinks and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children. She started her business to help her family. 

Rugiatu runs a fish vending business; she sells fish in her community. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Rugiatu says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mariama         A

texts.en:
Meet Mariama. She is 45 years old and is from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child. For the past 20 years, Mariama has has her small-scale retail business. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She wants to expand her business. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand it.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coconuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Mariama plans to open a foodstuffs table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coconuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Aminata from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children. She was a housewife; she started this business to contribute to the care of her children. 

Aminata runs a food stand business; she sells rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Aminata says that her business is doing well because she is able to take care of family with the profits from the business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking ingredients, such as rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking ingredients, such as rice, cooking oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 31 years old. She is single and resides with her mother and sister in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her mother sells Khmer noodles, porridge and desserts. She earns about $4 daily. Her sister is a garment worker who makes an income of $5 each day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Sreymom is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase farmland for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to fix her house to make it much better for her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is 42 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband is employed in a rice mill. He makes an income of $5 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 daily. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Chantha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses and help her children commute to work easily. In the future, she would like to fix her house and help her children pursue higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Tusisumbuane Group

texts.en:
Nyaskira, who is in her late 30s, is married with three sons and two daughters who are in school. For 12 months now, Nyaskira has been engaged with entrepreneurial activities where she sells small dry fish commonly known as dagaa in Tanzania. She started this business with a small amount of capital, but she keeps reinvesting her profits to increase her business. She works from 7am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use the loan to buy more dagaa to meet high demand. Nyaskira dreams to improve her family's standard of living and the business. She will share this loan with her loan group, "TUSISUMBUANE", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more dagaa (fish) to meet high demand.

loans.name: Las Amistosas De Rio Seco Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LAS AMISTOSAS DE RIO SECO, está compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varónes,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Yudith, tiene 42 años y tres hijos de 13, 11 y 5 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esta actividad, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Yudith va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como: papa y abarrotes al por mayor,  la señora Yudith enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la localidad hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
The "Las Amitosas de Rio Seco" communal bank is comprised of eight members, six women and two men. They work in various jobs. The president of the bank is Yudith, 42. She has three children ages 13, 11, and 5. She makes a living by selling food and has done so for several years. She sells from her food stall, which is located in her home in the town of El Torno.

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Yudith will use this loan to buy supplies for making food, including potatoes and wholesale groceries. Yudith faces challenges in her business, such as competition since many people in the area sell food. She will use her earnings to keep buying supplies so she can make great dishes. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Celix

texts.es: Celix, de 28 años, es un  hombre soñador y muy amable, está casada con Zoila con quien tiene una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad, juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo de Celix consiste en la venta ropa de segunda mano, trabaja vendiendo entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, empezó desde hace 2 años y le va muy bien. Sus ventas son al contado o al crédito y realiza la cobranza de manera semanal. Trabaja cómodamente sin descuidar a su pequeña hija. Se siente muy a gusto haciendo lo que hace ya que le es retribuido en los buenos ingresos que recibe. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 400, está muy emocionado al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería, entre las cosas que comprará ropa al por mayor tales como vestidos, polos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Celix, is a very kindhearted and ambitious young man of 28. He is married to Zoila and the couple has a three-year-old daughter. The family lives in its own home. Celix sells second-hand clothing for a living, selling to his friends, neighbors, and relatives. He began the business two years ago and it's going very well. Celix sells both for cash and on credit, collecting from customers weekly. His work allows him to manage his business comfortably while  caring for his young daughter.

Celix enjoys his work, and finds the income that the business generates rewarding. He is applying for a loan of S./ 400, and is very touched that there are people who will support him financially so he can continue to grow his business. Celix is therefore committed to being a reliable partner and to making timely payments. The funds from this loan will allow Celix to buy more wholesale merchandise, including suits, shirts, and other clothing items.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Jhosselyn

texts.es: Jhosselyn tiene 18 años es conviviente con 01 hijo. Ella es estudiante de confección industrial se encuentra en el segundo año de su carrera. Ella se siente muy contenta por estas solo a un año de para terminar su profesión. En sus tiempos libres cose sabana, blusas, polos. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres y pareja puede lograr uno de los sueños más importantes de su vida. El préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de sus módulos y en la compra de telas. Jhosselyn tiene como meta abrir su propio taller en donde confeccionara todo tipo de prenda. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por permitirle en alcanzar una de las metas de su vida.
texts.en:
Jhosselyn is eighteen years old and lives with her son.  She is a dressmaking student and is in her second year of study.  She is very happy that she only has one more year to complete in order to graduate from her classes.

In her free time, she sews sheets, blouses, and shirts.  Thanks to the support of her parents and her life partner, she has been able to reach one of her most important life dreams.

She will invest the loan in paying her education fees and buying more fabric.  Jhosselyn's goal is to open her own workshop where she will make all types of items.  She is grateful to the Kiva investors for allowing her to reach one of her life goals.

loans.use: to pay her education fees and to buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria  tiene 35 años casada con tres hijos de las edades de 10, 12 y 8 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos de segunda mano, ella vende sus productos en la populosa feria de la 16 de Julio de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Maria  va a usar este préstamo para compra de zapatos al por mayor por fardo ya que se acerca la época de fin de año y esta época es donde tiene mucha venta y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, su deseo es con el tiempo es poder vender variedad de ropa para distintas edades, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le dan el al otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, married and has three children aged 12, 10, and 8. She sells second-hand sports shoes. She sells her products at the busy "16 de Julio" market in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan with the institution and she will use it to buy shoes in bulk. The Christmas season is approaching and this is when she has high sales and needs to stock her business. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more merchandise. Maria is facing challenges to her business such as competition, and she will use this benefit to continue buying merchandise, thus generating more income. She wishes that with time she will be able to sell a variety of clothes for different ages. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been offered, because this business is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: El señor Javier es una persona humilde y responsable, está casado y tiene un hijo de 4 meses. Trabaja con una empresa de metales pero no tiene muchos recursos económicos, por ello solicita un crédito para la refacción de su vivienda, ya que en esta época de lluvias hay mucha filtración en el techo y existen goteras que están dañando su casa, pero con el crédito espera arreglar este problema y  mejorar las condiciones en las que vive su familia.
texts.en: Javier is a humble and responsible person. He is married and has a 4-month old son. He works at a metallurgy business but doesn't have many financial resources. That is why he is asking for a loan to repair his home. In the rainy season there are many water leakages in the roof and they are damaging his house. Javier hopes to fix the problem with the help from the loan and thus improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to repair his home.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has owned and operatesd a hog-raising business to earn a good living for five years. Aside from this, she also manages her vegetable garden to earn additional income. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and she used her previous loan for feeding supplies and it was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, to improve her garden. Lolita wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with two children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Salamatu runs a chicken vending business at home; she sells chicken in her community. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Salamatu says that the main challenges to her business are the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cartons of chicken for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cartons of chicken for resale.

loans.name: Booya

texts.en: Booya is 52-year-old male with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a cocoa business as his major source of income for the family. He gets the cocoa from his garden. He has been in the business since 1999. He sells his cocoa to one of the leading cocoa agents in the area, ESCO Uganda. He wishes to expand his business into new markets, though inadequate capital is a challenge. He wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan, a sus 43 años de edad, es casado y padre de 3 hijos. Durante 17 años trabajó como empleado en diferentes supermercados pero, con el ánimo de independizarse y generar recursos por cuenta propia, decidió retirarse de su empleo y montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en la casa donde reside, en el que trabaja solo, todos los días de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm, generando así los recursos económicos suficientes para sustentar las necesidades y gastos básicos de su familia. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre carismático, humilde y trabajador, siempre está en pro de servir a los demás. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, lácteos, cárnicos, gaseosas, chocolate, café, dulces, entre otros), así tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades de su clientela; lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas y el nivel de ganancia que obtiene. Juan desea seguir luchando para seguir adelante, fortalecer y hacer crecer su negocio, para que le genere una estabilidad financiera y en un futuro le permita adquirir un local y una casa propia para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Juan is forty-three years old, is married, and is the father of three children.  He has worked for seventeen years as an employee at different supermarkets.  However, with enthusiasm to become independent and to generate his own resources, he decided to retire from his work and has since begun his own grocery store business.  

His shop is located in the house where he lives.  He works by himself every day, from 6:00am to 10:00pm, and is able to generate sufficient economic income to cover his family's basic needs and expenses. His customers characterize him as a charismatic, humble, and hardworking man; he is always ready to serve others.  

Presently, he is requesting a loan to buy stock wholesale (pastries, cookies, milk products, meats, carbonated beverages, chocolate, coffee, sweets, and others).  In doing this, he will have a greater variety of products to offer and satisfy the diverse needs and tastes of his customers.  This will allow him to have better sales and to raise his profits.  

Juan hopes to continue fighting so that he may continue moving forward, strengthening and growing his business and giving him financial stability.  In the future, he hopes this will permit him to acquire a shop, his own house, and to offer his family a better standard of living and welfare.

loans.use: to buy items wholesale, including pastries, cookies, milk products, meats, carbonated beverages, chocolate, coffee, sweets, and others).

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 43 years old and married with four children. She runs a domestic product sales business in Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to improve the living conditions of her family.  

She's been in this business since after the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers in her community. She says that the main problem for her business is improper business location.

Musu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon is 58 years old. She is widowed and resides with her granddaughter in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her granddaughter is a garment worker who makes an income of $6 each day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Huon is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a cow in order to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to be able to stabilize her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calves to sell

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en: Sambat is 48 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a farm worker for more than three years, earning approximately $2 per day. All of her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $9 daily. To improve her family’s livelihood, Sambat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase clothes and shoes to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate additional income for the family. In the future, she would like to raise a pig and rebuild her house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.ru:
Лилия занимается продажей трикотажа, спортивной обуви. У нее большой опыт работы и собственное торговое место на рынке. Самые продаваемые товары в бизнессе: трикотаж, спортивная обувь, тапки и галоши. Лилия трудолювая, ответственная и заботится о благополучии семьи.

Лилия благодарит за предыдущий КИВА кредит, багодаря которому она увеличила ассортимент товара, что привлекло больше покупателей. В этот раз Лилия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10 000 гривен на закупку сезонной обуви. Кредит поможет предложить своим клиентам более качественный товар и таким образом увеличить своих доходы. 

Лилия замужем. У нее есть взрослый сын.
texts.en:
Lilya sells hosiery and sports shoes.  She has a great deal of experience in this business and she has her own stall at the market.  Her best selling items are hosiery, sports shoes, slippers, and galoshes.  Lilya is hard working, responsible, and cares a great deal about her family's wellbeing.  She is married and has an adult son.

Lilya is grateful for an earlier loan from Kiva, which enabled her to expand her inventory and attract more customers.  This time, Lilya is requesting a loan of 10,000 hryvni (UAH) to buy seasonal shoes.   The loan will help her to offer her clients higher quality goods, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a seasonal inventory

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal, 45 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store for two years. During summer time, she and her husband make and sell boardwalk decks to local people. Their elder daughter studies at technology college. 

Using her previous loan, she made an extension to her house, as well as insulated the walls. Now she is requesting a loan of MNT 6,000,000 to buy vacuum insulated windows, a low pressure heater and hardwood floor. After installing those items, the house her family lives in will be energy efficient thus requiring less coal burning for heating. Decreased coal burning has a significant impact on reducing air pollution.

loans.use: to buy vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and a low pressure heater

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is a woman who lives together with her husband, daughter and niece in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 1994, she has been working as an outdoor photographer in order to generate income. In 1999, her daughter began following her footsteps. 

Purevsuren is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy a printer, film, frames and papers. Because her equipment is used frequently and the odds of malfunction are common, a constant supply of new equipment is core to her business.

loans.use: to purchase a printer, frames, film and color papers.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids, two sons and three daughters, in a small simple house in the city. Yousef works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Yousef would like to improve the family living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water-purification machine for his home. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to provide pure water for his family, since the water in his area is not clean. 

Yousef appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water-purification machine for his home

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
To generate income, Irene engages in selling snack foods and drinks in the street and in the bus terminal. 

She is 30 years old and has two school-aged children. She aims to earn higher income in order to finance the education of her children and satisfy their necessities. 

To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more stock of coconut pie, coconut juice and mineral water to sell. She believes that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of coconut pie, coconut juice and mineral water to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hard working mother and blessed with three children. To generate income, she engages in selling snack foods in the rural community. She aims to earn and save more income in order to satisfy their necessities and save for their future. 

To further improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy boiled corn, coconut pie, coconut juice and momma to sell. Through her patience and determination she believes that her business will continue generating more profit.

loans.use: to buy boiled corn, coconut pie, coconut juice and momma to sell

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia is a  married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Consorcia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Consorcia has hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with three children, selling seafood products including fish, crabs, and shrimp in the market earning a good living. For five years she has been able to support her children's education through running the business. 

She used her previous loan from GDMPC micro credit for her business and it was successfully repaid. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional sea food to resell. Elvie is hopeful to generate more profit from her business to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sea food to resell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra manages her food vending business as an aid to her husband's income from employment. She has been selling food and snacks in the market in town every weekend and cooks some made-to-order snacks for her customers at home. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMOC micro credit to purchase raw ingredients to cook. She is hopeing to save more money for their future needs and Alejandra wants to have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has four children. She manages a business buying and selling crabs. For five years in her business, Lilian has earned enough so that she has been able to provide for her family's daily needs. 

Lilian successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC that she used to buy crabs. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell. Lilian is determined to save a portion of her profit for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional crabs and prawn to sell.

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio is married with two children and he manages his own farm for a living. For eighteen years, he has been in the corn production business. 

Elpedio earns a good enough income for the family's daily living. He always finds ways to boost his farm to augment their situation. 

Recently, Elpedio took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to have a greener pasture. He hopes to improve the general living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en: Lelia is married and has four children. She has owned and operated a retail business for nine years earning a good living. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used her previous loan in her business and it helped a lot in running the business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to resell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy more products for his general store which has been running for four years now. His income from the business is helping support everyday expenses at home. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their family since their children will soon go to school.
 
He would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, and he will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Darwin hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to give a good future to his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Ana Zhien

texts.en:
Ana Zhien is 33 years old and married.

Ana Zhien works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Ana Zhien has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Ana Zhien aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.ru:
Руслана работает учительницей игры на фортепиано в  школе  искусства. Она хорошо воспитана и образована. Руслана серьезно относится ко всем расходам, ведет четкий расчет доходов и расходов. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Руслана поменяла двери (это видно на фото) и отремонтировала полы в доме. Однако закончить ремонт не удалось и нужны дополнительные средства.  

В этот раз Руслана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20 000 на ремонт ванной комнаты в их доме.  Ванна была построена еще во времена советского союза и сейчас выглядит ужасно. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия семьи.
texts.en:
Ruslana is a teacher of acting and piano at an art school.  She is well-bred and educated.  Ruslana is serious about minding her expenses and she keeps to a strict budget.  Thanks to her earlier loan, Ruslana replaced her door (as you can see in the photo) and repaired her floors.  However, she was not able to finish all the repairs and she needs additional funds.  

This time, Ruslana is requesting a loan of 20,000 UAH to fix the bathroom.  The bathroom was installed way back in Soviet times and now it looks just awful.  The loan will help her to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница района Шахритус. Она замужем за Бахтиёра. У них двое совместных детей. Дочери 19 лет, а младшему сыну 15 лет. Дилором нигде не работает, она домохозяйка. Дилором сидела дома и присматривала за детьми. Теперь, когда ее дети повзрослели, она может работать. Дилором решила начать свой бизнес по продаже кондитерских изделий. Дилором насчитанная и ответственная женщина. Она нашла и арендовала место для продажи и нашла оптовых продавцов.
